0.title: Police officer demands ₹5 lakh extortion money in Pune; booked
0.article_body: Pune's Vimantal police have filed a case against a police officer for allegedly demanding ₹5 lakh extortion money from a petrol pump owner for the smooth functioning of his business. According to the complaint, the incident took place in September and the accused apparently threatened the petrol pump's owner with "dire consequences" if he failed to pay the money.

1.title: He somehow cleared class 12, only wanted to play cricket: Patidar's father
1.article_body: Batter Rajat Patidar's father Manohar Patidar said he wasn't interested in anything else apart from cricket, adding that he somehow managed to clear Class 12. "His movement was restricted from home to the ground (for practice)," he stated. Reacting to Rajat receiving his maiden Team India call-up for the ODI series against South Africa, Manohar said, "It is very normal."

2.title: Woman finds pencil in Burger King meal in UK; shares pic as staff tell her 'Not to worry'
2.article_body: A woman found a pencil in her Burger King meal in UK's Bootle. Leanne Daly shared a pic of the pencil that she found in her burger after staff at the Burger King outlet told her "not to worry". "We apologise for the impact this incident has caused and have investigated the matter raised," a spokesperson said.

3.title: Ola, Uber, Rapido's auto services declared illegal in B'luru, ordered to discontinue
3.article_body: Karnataka Transport Department has issued notices to cab aggregators like Ola, Uber, and Rapido, ordering them to discontinue their auto services in Bengaluru, calling it illegal. The development comes after complaints of aggregators charging ₹100 for a 2 km auto ride. "Submit an explanation about illegal autorickshaw operation...within 3 days. If not, legal action will be taken," the notice said.

4.title: Dabur India stock falls after it expects Q2 margin to be hit
4.article_body: Dabur India's stock traded lower on Friday, a day after the FMCG major said in its business update for the September quarter that the geopolitical environment continued to have a high inflationary impact on its business. Dabur said its operating margin could be 150-200 basis points lower year-on-year. Its shares were trading 1.87% lower on the BSE at 11:10 am.

5.title: Global economy moving towards greater uncertainty: IMF chief
5.article_body: International Monetary Fund (IMF) chief Kristalina Georgieva said that the global economy is moving from a world of relative predictability to one of greater uncertainty. She warned that about one-third of the world economy will experience at least two consecutive quarters of contraction. IMF in July slashed its growth forecast for this year to 3.2% and to 2.9% for 2023.

6.title: Upset over 14-yr-old son's suicide after being scolded, Chennai man kills self
6.article_body: A 40-year-old man died by suicide after his son killed himself in Chennai. The 14-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide after being scolded by his father over playing mobile games. The son took the step when he was alone in the house. The man locked himself in a room after finding out about his son's death and died by suicide.

7.title: 2 youths saved from getting washed away in U'khand; video surfaces
7.article_body: Two youths from Uttar Pradesh were saved from getting washed away in a river at Sharda Ghat in Uttarakhand's Tanakpur by a swimmer of the state police and a local youth, police tweeted on Thursday. The police also shared a video of the incident, which shows the swimmer and the local youth bringing the duo to the shore.

8.title: US & South Korea hold maritime drills after North Korea's missile launch
8.article_body: The US and South Korea held joint maritime drills on South Korea's east coast, country's Joint Chiefs of Staff said. The drills, involving a US aircraft carrier, come after North Korea launched ballistic missiles into the sea on Thursday and flew warplanes near the border with South Korea. The US, Japan and South Korea recently held trilateral missile defence exercises.

9.title: 2 killed, 6 wounded after man goes on stabbing spree along Las Vegas Strip
9.article_body: At least two people have been killed and six others have been wounded after a man armed with a large kitchen knife went on a stabbing spree along the casino-lined Las Vegas Strip in the US on Thursday, officials said. The suspect, who was described as a Hispanic man in his 30s, was taken into custody soon after the attack.

10.title: 3 more bodies recovered, death toll reaches 19 in Uttarkashi avalanche
10.article_body: At least three more bodies were recovered from the site of an avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district, the Nehru Institute of Mountaineering (NIM) said on Friday. The death toll has now climbed to 19, it added. While 17 of these bodies are of trainee mountaineers, two are of their instructors, it further said.

11.title: 500 raids in 3 months, nothing found: Kejriwal as ED raids 35 sites
11.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday reacted to Enforcement Directorate (ED) carrying out searches at around 35 locations in connection with the Delhi excise policy case, alleging that all the officials "are trying to find proof against...[Deputy CM Manish Sisodia]". "Over 500 raids, more than 300 CBI/ED officials have been working 24x7 for three months...Nothing has been found," he added.

12.title: 27-year-old wanted criminal arrested after shootout in Noida Film City
12.article_body: A 27-year-old criminal, identified as Danish who is wanted in multiple cases, was arrested following a shootout in Noida Film City on Friday, police said. "A police check was set up near Brahmaputra Market...Danish was intercepted...he fled the spot. Nearby police posts were alerted about the development," police added. An associate of Danish who was with him escaped, police stated.

13.title: India announce their playing XI for women's Asia Cup 2022 match against Pakistan
13.article_body: Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof won the toss and elected to bat first against India in their women's Asia Cup 2022 match. India captain Harmanpreet Kaur is back in the playing XI, replacing KP Navgire, while Radha Yadav has replaced Sneh Rana. India are currently the only unbeaten side in the tournament.

14.title: New Zealand PM invites PM Modi for a visit, says ties growing stronger
14.article_body: New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern invited PM Narendra Modi to visit the island nation and said that the relationship between both countries has been growing stronger. "Both nations care for...democratic traditions and share an interest in a peaceful and prosperous Indo-Pacific region. We share concern for climate change and have similar passions for celebrating different cultures," added Ardern.

15.title: RTO starts drive against older petrol and diesel vehicles in Noida
15.article_body: The transport department in Noida has launched a drive to phase out all petrol vehicles older than 15 years and diesel vehicles older than 10 years. "We will ask all such vehicle owners to get their vehicles scrapped or get a no-objection certificate (NOC) for other districts where the air quality is better," said an officer.

16.title: 74-yr-old Indian-American man shoots dead daughter-in-law in US parking lot, arrested
16.article_body: A 74-year-old Indian-American man, Sital Singh Dosanjh, was arrested for fatally shooting his daughter-in-law Gurpreet Kaur Dosanjh at a parking lot in California, US. Gurpreet had seen Sital driving in the lot of the Walmart where she worked, indicating that he travelled 241km to find her, her uncle said. She was in the process of divorcing Sital's son, he added.

17.title: New Vande Bharat Express damaged after hitting buffaloes repaired within 24 hours
17.article_body: The new Vande Bharat Express damaged after hitting buffaloes while running between Mumbai Central and Gujarat's Gandhinagar has been repaired within 24 hours. "The nose cover is designed to absorb the impact without transmitting the same to the functional parts of the train. Therefore, it is sacrificial by design and hence replaceable," an official said.

18.title: Far-right US group Proud Boys' member admits to seditious conspiracy
18.article_body: A member of far-right group in the US, Proud Boys, has pleaded guilty to plotting with other members to stop the transfer of presidential power after the 2020 election. Jeremy Joseph Bertino participated in planning the riots and received encrypted messages indicating storming the Capitol, authorities said. "We're on cusp of saving the constitution," Bertino had written on social media.

19.title: 2022 FIFA World Cup will surely be my last: Lionel Messi
19.article_body: Seven-time Ballon d'Or winner Lionel Messi has said that the upcoming 2022 FIFA World Cup will "surely" be his last. "I'm counting down the days to the World Cup. There is anxiety and nerves at the same time. Wanting it to be now, what is going to happen, and ultimately, how is it going to go?" Messi stated.

20.title: Spanish university male students shout vulgar threats at women; PM Sanchez reacts
20.article_body: A Spanish university dormitory said on Thursday that it has expelled several male students caught on video yelling vulgar threats at female students in a neighbouring block. Reacting to the video, Spain's Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said actions that "generate hate and threaten women" would not be tolerated, adding, "It's especially painful to see the protagonists are young people."

21.title: 50-yr-old woman raped, kicked in private parts by 2 policemen in Jharkhand
21.article_body: A 50-year-old woman was allegedly raped by two policemen while she was in a field to cut grass in Jharkhand's Lohardaga district, police said. "The two policemen took turns to rape her and also kicked her in the private parts, which led to excessive bleeding," the complaint said. The woman sustained serious injuries and is currently undergoing treatment.

22.title: Amazon shuts down field tests of home delivery robot Scout
22.article_body: Amazon is ending field tests of its home delivery robot Scout as the program did not completely meet customers' needs, the company said on Thursday. The e-commerce firm started testing Scout on sidewalks outside Seattle in 2019. Employees working on Scout will be offered new roles, an Amazon spokesperson said, adding that the company was not abandoning the project altogether.

23.title: Pune City Police arrests man for cheating 200 people over fake loans
23.article_body: Pune City Police arrested a man who cheated about 200 persons in Maharashtra over fake instant loans. The accused used to tell victims to transfer ₹4,000- ₹5,000 as "processing fee", police said. "The accused used to leave home...telling (his) family that he has got a job, but used to...cheat people by posting fake advertisements on social media platforms," police added.

24.title: Man taking joyride at Dussehra fair electrocuted to death in Ludhiana
24.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly electrocuted to death while taking a joyride at a Dussehra fair in Ludhiana on Wednesday. A few other people also said they felt a slight electric shock. However, the caretaker of the ride denied the electrocution claim and said the victim vomited, fell on the ground and later died of cardiac arrest.

25.title: US advises citizens against travelling to Pakistan, cites 'terrorism & violence'
25.article_body: The US has urged its citizens to reconsider travel to Pakistan, especially its restive provinces including Balochistan and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KPK) provinces. "Reconsider travel to Pakistan due to terrorism and sectarian violence. Some areas have increased risk," the US State Department said. "Terrorists may attack with little or no warning," the advisory stated.

26.title: Binance-backed blockchain probes $100 million token theft
26.article_body: Binance-backed blockchain, BNB Chain, has launched an investigation into a potential theft of between $100 million and $110 million worth of digital tokens native to the network. A BNB Chain developer said on Reddit that the issue has been contained and user funds are safe. However, the developer also mentioned that about $7 million of stolen funds have been frozen.

27.title: Fitness equipment maker Peloton to fire 500 employees
27.article_body: US-based exercise equipment maker Peloton has said it is planning to layoff about 500 employees. Peloton's CEO Barry McCarthy said if the company can't turn itself around in about six months, it might not be a viable standalone company. He later clarified that his reported statement was at odds with the story he told and the state of the business.

28.title: Man charged with smuggling 3 pythons in his pants across US-Canada border
28.article_body: A 36-year-old man has been charged with allegedly smuggling three Burmese pythons in his pants at a US-Canadian border crossing. Calvin Bautista is accused of bringing the hidden snakes on a bus that crossed into northern New York in July 2018. Importing Burmese pythons is banned in the US as the species is considered "injurious to human beings".

29.title: Deficiencies at Biocon's Bengaluru drug plant listed by European body
29.article_body: The European Directorate for the Quality of Medicines & HealthCare (EDQM) has listed out deficiencies related to Biocon's API (active pharma ingredient or bulk drug) manufacturing site in Bengaluru after an inspection, the company said in a filing on Thursday. The Bengaluru-headquartered company said that while no deficiencies were marked as critical, one was listed as major.

30.title: Samsung's quarterly profit falls for first time in nearly 3 years
30.article_body: Samsung Electronics reported a 32% drop in quarterly operating earnings on Friday. Its estimated profit fell to 10.8 trillion won ($7.67 billion) in July-September, which is the first year-on-year decline in nearly three years, the company said in a preliminary earnings release. The slump was driven by a fall in demand for electronic devices and the chips that power them.

31.title: Sanju Samson can hit 6 sixes in an over like Yuvraj Singh: Steyn
31.article_body: Ex-South Africa pacer Dale Steyn said Sanju Samson has the same potential as ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh, adding he can hit six sixes in an over like Yuvraj did. "As soon as Kagiso Rabada bowled that no-ball in the last ball of his over, I was like, 'Please don't let this happen'...You never know with someone like Samson," stated Steyn.

32.title: BJP fixed only 73 government schools in Gujarat over 27 years: Sisodia
32.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, who is set to visit government schools in Gujarat, said BJP fixed only 73 government schools over 27 years. "At this rate, it'll take BJP 15,000 years to fix 40,800 Gujarat government schools," he added. "These days, whenever Arvind Kejriwal and I visit Gujarat, people show us schools with...no facilities for their children," Sisodia stated.

33.title: Mashal Sports announces vivo PKL Season 9 from 7th Oct, 7:30 pm onwards
33.article_body: Mashal Sports initiative vivo Pro Kabaddi League announced that Season 9 is all about #FantasticPanga. The aim of this season is to celebrate the fans who will be returning to the stadiums after 3 years. Starting 7th October, 7:30 pm onwards, the season will take place in Bengaluru, Pune and Hyderabad.

34.title: Man who kidnapped, murdered Indian-origin family in US once worked for them: Relative
34.article_body: The man who kidnapped and murdered an Indian-origin Sikh family, including an eight-month-old baby girl, had once worked for the family's trucking business, a relative said. Jesus Manuel Salgado had a longstanding dispute with them that got "pretty nasty", according to authorities. The family, originally from Hoshiarpur, Punjab, was kidnapped in Merced County, California.

35.title: 2 Russians sail to US' Alaska to avoid Putin's military draft, seek asylum
35.article_body: Two Russian men sailed to US' Alaska in a small boat to avoid being drafted to fight in Ukraine, US authorities said. The men, who'd made the 300-mile journey from Egvekinot to St Lawrence Island in Alaska, have been detained and are seeking asylum in the US, they added. Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a partial military mobilisation last month.

36.title: Truck carrying devotees overturns as brakes fail near Pune; 13 hurt
36.article_body: At least 13 devotees were injured after a truck in which they were travelling overturned near Pune on Thursday. The incident occurred after the truck's brakes failed while negotiating a slope in Shindawane Ghat and the vehicle skidded in loose soil when the driver tried to stop it, an officer said. The devotees suffered minor injuries, the officer added.

37.title: 4 of family injured as 24-yr-old drunk motorist hits 2-wheeler in Mumbai
37.article_body: Four people from a family were injured after a 24-year-old man, who was driving under the influence of alcohol, crashed into their two-wheeler in Mumbai. The motorist was driving on the wrong side of the road, reports said. A 40-year-old man and his 35-year-old wife sustained fractures in the incident. Meanwhile, their two children sustained head injuries.

38.title: NCB seizes drugs worth ₹120 crore from Gujarat, Mumbai; 6 arrested
38.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) seized MD drugs worth ₹120 crore from Gujarat and Mumbai, officials said on Friday. About 50 kg drugs concealed in a godown in Mumbai were recovered, while over 10 kg drugs were seized in Gujarat's Jamnagar. A former Air India pilot was among those arrested, according to an NCB official.

39.title: 50% of work on Ram Mandir in Ayodhya completed: Yogi Adityanath
39.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has confirmed that 50 percent of the work on the under-construction Ram Mandir in Ayodhya has been completed. "Dedicated efforts were made to realise the dream of Ram Mandir, for which the movement started in 1949," said the CM. Earlier in August 2020, PM Modi laid the foundation stone for the construction of the temple.

40.title: ED summons DK Shivakumar & his brother in money laundering case
40.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has summoned Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar and his brother DK Suresh to its Delhi office in a money laundering case today. Earlier, Congress leaders had requested the agency to give them time in view of the "Bharat Jodo Yatra." However, ED rejected the request to extend the date of their appearance.

41.title: Noida resident thrashes guard after altercation over dog; both held
41.article_body: A housing society's resident and a security guard were arrested after an altercation allegedly broke out between the two over a dog and the former thrashed the guard in Noida on Thursday, police said. The incident occurred after the resident's wife asked the guard to remove the dog from the common area but he refused, a police spokesperson said.

42.title: Spirit of cricket has become redundant: Hogg on Chahar's 'mankad' warning
42.article_body: Reacting to Deepak Chahar warning Tristan Stubbs about 'mankading' in the third T20I between India and South Africa, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg tweeted, "Batter breaks the law, bowler doesn't use the law." "No disappointment about the batter's action...We don't accept [the] umpire's decision with [the] use of DRS as well...'Spirit of cricket' has become redundant," added Hogg in his tweet.

43.title: 3 top ISIS terrorists killed in separate US military operations in Syria
43.article_body: The US military on Thursday said it has killed three senior Islamic State (ISIS) leaders in two separate operations in Syria. Among those killed was Abu-Hashum al-Umawi, deputy leader of ISIS militant group in Syria and one of the top five most senior ISIS members worldwide. The airstrikes are the first known US operations in a government-held area in Syria.

44.title: Tesla Semi's production started, PepsiCo to get 1st delivery: Musk
44.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Thursday announced that the production of Tesla Semi truck has started and PepsiCo will receive the first deliveries starting December 1. The all-electric truck, which was first unveiled in 2017, was supposed to go into production within two years. PepsiCo had placed an order for 100 Semi trucks soon after the truck was launched.

45.title: Mob enters heritage madrasa, performs puja in Karnataka; 9 booked
45.article_body: Nine people were booked and four were reportedly arrested on Thursday after a mob allegedly entered Mohamud Gawan Madrasa in Karnataka's Bidar and performed puja, police said. The mob was a part of a  Dussehra procession. The madrasa, built in 1472 AD, is a heritage building maintained by the Archaeological Survey of India. A video of the incident surfaced online.

46.title: Former WWE wrestler Sara Lee passes away aged 30
46.article_body: Former WWE wrestler Sara Lee has passed away at the age of 30. "As a former "Tough Enough" winner, Lee served as an inspiration to many in the sports-entertainment world. WWE offers its heartfelt condolences to her family, friends and fans," WWE tweeted. The cause of her death has not been disclosed.

47.title: Mukesh Ambani, Asia's 2nd-richest man, to open family office in Singapore: Report
47.article_body: Mukesh Ambani, Asia's second-richest man and Chairman of Reliance Industries, is setting up a family office in Singapore, Bloomberg reported. Ambani has appointed a manager to hire staff for the new entity and also chosen real estate, the report said. Ambani, who currently has a net worth of $83.7 billion, reportedly wants the office to be running within a year.

48.title: US blacklists 13 more firms over alleged ties to China's military
48.article_body: US Department of Defense has blacklisted 13 more Chinese companies, alleging they have ties with China's military. DJI Technology, the world's largest manufacturer of consumer drones, and BGI Genomics are among the firms that have been blacklisted. The companies have been added to a list that bars US entities from buying or selling publicly traded securities in target companies.

49.title: US President Biden pardons thousands of Americans convicted of marijuana possession
49.article_body: US President Joe Biden took executive action to change US policy on marijuana, pardoning all prior federal offenses of simple marijuana possession. "There are thousands...who've prior federal convictions for marijuana possession, who may be denied employment, housing, or educational opportunities," Biden said. "My action will help relieve collateral consequences arising from such convictions."

50.title: BBMP to resume demolition drive after Dussehra break
50.article_body: Bengaluru's civic body BBMP will resume its demolition drive to remove encroachments in the city from Monday, after the Dussehra break. "The JCBs (earth movers) will be taken to demolish homes and other structures from Monday according to the relevant laws," said BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath. Notably, the city saw waterlogging and flooding in August and September.

51.title: India reports 1,997 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 30,362
51.article_body: India reported 1,997 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,529 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 30,362. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,754 following nine fatalities in the last 24 hours.

52.title: I fell short by 2 shots: Samson after India's loss in 1st ODI vs SA
52.article_body: Sanju Samson said he "fell short" by two shots in the first ODI between India and South Africa which the former lost by nine runs. "I knew if I had to get 24 runs in the final over, I can hit four sixes," added Samson. Samson scored 86* off 63 balls with his knock comprising nine fours and three sixes.

53.title: 2 youths invited for meeting in Delhi killed due to envy over Insta followers
53.article_body: Three juveniles, including one girl, were apprehended for allegedly killing two youths in Delhi. Reports said that the girl and one of the deceased used to envy each other over the number of followers they had on Instagram. The victims were reportedly invited to meet by the accused, after which, they were killed. They died during treatment at the hospital.

54.title: Video shows men going near tiger in MP forest for pics; IFS officer says 'never do this'
54.article_body: A video showing men going near a tiger to take its pictures and videos in Panna Tiger Reserve in Madhya Pradesh has surfaced online. IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted, "No animal want trouble including these massive tigers. All they want is space. Friends never do this." "The tiger can maul you to death feeling threatened," wrote IFS officer Susanta Nanda.

55.title: Clerk suspended over Ravana effigy not burning properly in Chhattisgarh
55.article_body: A municipal clerk was allegedly suspended after the effigy of Ravana didn't burn properly in Chhattisgarh's Dhamtari during Dussehra celebrations. The city's municipal commissioner issued an order to suspend the clerk citing "serious negligence" in preparing the effigy, according to reports. The order, which was reportedly issued on Thursday, stated that this tarnished the municipal body's image.

56.title: ED raids 35 locations in Delhi, Punjab in Delhi excise policy case
56.article_body: Enforcement Directorate is carrying out searches at around 35 locations in Delhi and Punjab in connection with the Delhi excise policy case. The searches are underway at premises linked to liquor businessmen, distributors and supply chain networks. Notably, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia is among the people named as accused in CBI's FIR in the case.

57.title: Kolkata Puja immerses Durga idol in artificial tank for 1st time in 190 yrs
57.article_body: A 190-year-old Kolkata Puja immersed its Durga idol in an artificial tank for the first time. This was reportedly done in a bid to keep pollution in check. A four feet high tank, which was six feet in diameter, was used for the immersion. Reports said that the tank was equipped with two jet sprayers.

58.title: 4 officials suspended after drug peddler escapes custody in Patiala
58.article_body: Four officials of Patiala Central Jail were suspended days after a drug peddler named Amrik Singh escaped from custody. DSP (Security) Varun Sharma posted for prison security, Assistant Superintendent-cum-Warrant Officer Harbans Singh, Jail Warder Satpal Singh and Mandeep Singh have been suspended," an official spokesperson said. Amrik Singh was taken to a hospital from where he escaped.

59.title: All that remains is hanging: Chidambaram on police caning men in Guj
59.article_body: After a video showed police in Gujarat's Kheda publically caning men, Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday said, "First, bulldozing. Now, flogging. All that remains is hanging." The men who were being caned had allegedly pelted stones at a garba event. "In UP, Assam and now in Gujarat, the state police has become Judge, Jury and Hangman," he added.

60.title: Hyderabad zoo gets new attractions as it completes 59th year
60.article_body: Hyderabad's Nehru Zoological Park completed the 59th year of its formation on Thursday. A pair of meerkats and a pair of white-eared marmosets were added to the list of attractions. Officials also unveiled an open fish pond with varieties of fish. A cub of an Asiatic lioness was named 'Adhiti' by RM Dobriyal, Principal Chief Conservator of Forests, Telangana.

61.title: Prince Harry, Elton John sue UK media group over privacy breaches
61.article_body: Britain's Prince Harry and singer Elton John are among several public figures suing the publisher of Daily Mail newspaper over alleged phone tapping and other breaches of privacy. The others involved in the legal action are actresses Elizabeth Hurley and Sadie Frost, Elton John's husband and filmmaker David Furnish, and Doreen Lawrence, the mother of murder victim Stephen Lawrence.

62.title: Priyanka Chopra shares post on Iran anti-hijab protests over death of 22-year-old
62.article_body: Amid anti-hijab protests in Iran over the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in the custody of Iran's morality police, Priyanka Chopra wrote, "The voices that speak after ages of forced silence, will rightfully burst like a volcano...I stand with you." "Add your voice to this critical movement," Priyanka added. Amini was arrested on September 13 in Tehran for "inappropriate attire".

63.title: Won't attend India-Pakistan match in T20 World Cup 2022, I get into fights: Ramiz Raja
63.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Ramiz Raja has said he won't attend India-Pakistan match at T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. He stated he doesn't watch Pakistan's matches from stadiums as he gets into fights with people. "People are inviting me to attend the first match of World Cup, but I will watch the matches sitting at home," he added.

64.title: Mumbai to witness moderate rains with thunderstorms in next 2 days: IMD
64.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light to moderate rainfall with thunderstorms over Mumbai in the next couple of days. "All India severe weather warnings have been issued by IMD for the coming 5 days…Northern parts of Raigad district, Navi Mumbai, Ratnagiri, ghat areas of Pune and Satara have the possibilities of moderate thunderstorms," said the IMD official.

65.title: Rupee falls to record low of 82.16 against US dollar
65.article_body: The rupee declined to a record low of 82.16 against the US dollar on Friday. It had closed at 81.89 on Thursday. The dollar index, which tracks the American currency against a basket of six major peers, was at 112.032 following a rally after a two-week low. Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty opened in the red amid weak global cues.

66.title: Electronics Mart India shares trading at 60% premium in grey markets
66.article_body: Electronics Mart India Limited's shares are trading at a premium of nearly 60% over the upper price band in grey markets, analysts said. The ₹500-crore public offer opened for bidding on October 4 and the price band was set at ₹56-₹59 per share. On Thursday, which was the second day of offer, the IPO was subscribed 7.57 times.

67.title: Twitter's lawsuit against Elon Musk halted to allow $44 billion deal to close
67.article_body: Twitter's lawsuit against Elon Musk over his $44 billion purchase of the company has been halted to allow the parties more time to close the deal. If the transaction isn't completed by October 28, new trial dates will be set, Delaware Chancery Judge Kathaleen McCormick said. Musk has proposed to buy Twitter for the original price of $54.20 per share.

68.title: Uttar Pradesh should be pothole-free by November 15: CM Yogi to officials
68.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath ordered a statewide campaign and directed officials to make the state pothole-free by November 15, the CM's office said. This comes following a high-level meeting held on Thursday. "Good roads and better connectivity are everyone's rights," he said. CM Adityanath also reviewed the preparations for the 81st session of the Indian Road Congress (IRC).

69.title: Man claims Flipkart sent iPhone 14 instead of iPhone 13 to customer; shares pics
69.article_body: A Twitter user has claimed that Flipkart sent iPhone 14 to one of his followers who had ordered iPhone 13 on the e-commerce platform. The man shared pictures of the order summary and the product received by the customer. While several people on Twitter called the customer 'lucky', a user wrote, "So even Flipkart knows it's the same phone."

70.title: Gang of women surround woman on Gurugram road, steal purse with ₹15000
70.article_body: A gang of women dressed in white sarees allegedly stole another woman's purse which had ₹15000 cash, her phone and documents like PAN and Aadhaar card. The incident took place when the accused women surrounded the victim on a road in Gurugram amid the Dussehra rush. "All of the suspects dispersed immediately after the theft," police said.

71.title: US Prez Biden pardons thousands convicted of marijuana possession
71.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Thursday pardoned all people with federal convictions for "simple possession" of marijuana. There are thousands of people who've prior federal convictions, who may be denied employment, housing or educational opportunities, and this move would relieve such "collateral" consequences, Biden said.  "No one should be in jail just for using or possessing marijuana," he added.

72.title: 22 kids killed by gunman in mass shooting at Thailand daycare were sleeping
72.article_body: The 22 kids who were killed by a gunman in mass shooting at a daycare in Thailand were sleeping, according to Piyalak Kingkaew, who led the rescue team that was the first to arrive. "Nobody wants this to happen. It's a scene that nobody wants to see. It's harrowing," Kingkaew added. The attacker later killed himself.

73.title: B'luru to get 4 multi-speciality hospitals, 243 Namma Clinics: CM
73.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that four multi-speciality hospitals and 243 Namma Clinics will be set up in Bengaluru. "20 PHCs (primary health centres) will also be upgraded. ₹500 crore has been earmarked to provide cochlear implantation free of cost for the poor," he added. Bommai inaugurated a 50-bed subcentre of the Jayadeva Institute of Cardiology.

74.title: Man who impersonated woman on social media arrested in Gr Noida
74.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested in Greater Noida for allegedly setting up fake social media accounts impersonating his female friend and posting inappropriate pictures, police said. The accused had befriended the woman six years ago but she got married to someone else, a police official said. "[The accused] also called...[woman's] husband and hurled abuses at him," the police official added.

75.title: Nuclear 'Armageddon' risk highest since 1962, Putin is not joking: US President
75.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that the risk of nuclear 'Armageddon' is at the highest level since the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis. "[Russian President Vladimir Putin] is not joking when he talks about potential use of tactical nuclear weapons or biological and chemical weapons," Biden warned. The threat from Putin is real "because his military is...significantly underperforming", he added.

76.title: IMD issues moderate rainfall warning for Pune for next 2 days
76.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Thursday issued a warning for moderate rainfall over Pune and its neighbouring areas for the next two days. Pune and other districts will witness thunderstorms, lightning and rainfall till October 8, it added. "Due to (a) cyclonic circulation, moisture-laden winds...being pulled from the Arabian Sea and Bay of Bengal over Maharashtra," an official said.

77.title: Started rescuing but there was little we could do: U'khand avalanche survivor
77.article_body: Naib Subedar Anil Kumar, a survivor in Uttarakhand avalanche incident that took place on October 4, said that the avalanche unhooked three to four ropes and those who were anchored to the ropes fell into the crevasse. "When the snow began to settle...I undid ropes and started to rescue my teammates. However, there was little we could do," he said.

78.title: Pune man makes hoax call about plot to kill PM to frame neighbours
78.article_body: A 38-year-old man was arrested from Pune's Dehu road area after he made a hoax call claiming that a plot was being hatched in a flat to kill PM Narendra Modi. The accused allegedly made the call to "teach a lesson" to his neighbours as he was annoyed by the noise made by their children, a police official said.

79.title: Veteran actor Arun Bali passes away aged 79
79.article_body: Veteran actor Arun Bali, who has worked in films like '3 Idiots', 'PK', 'Kedarnath' and 'Panipat', passed away at the age of 79 on Friday, news agency ANI reported. He was diagnosed with a rare neuromuscular disease called myasthenia gravis in January this year. Bali's last film 'Goodbye', starring Amitabh Bachchan and Neena Gupta, is set to be released today.

80.title: India abstains from voting at UNHRC on holding debate on China's treatment of Uyghurs
80.article_body: India on Thursday abstained from voting at UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC) on holding a debate on China's treatment of Uyghur Muslims in Xinjiang. The draft resolution on "holding a debate on the situation of human rights in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China" was rejected after 17 members voted in favour, 19 members voted against and 11 abstentions.

81.title: Two 17-yr-old boys stabbed to death in Delhi, 3 minors apprehended
81.article_body: Police apprehended three minors after two boys aged around 17 were stabbed to death in Delhi's Mukundpur. A 17-year-old girl who lives in the neighbourhood called the victims on Wednesday night, police said. The girl was with her brother and two friends, and when the victims reached the spot, an altercation took place between the two sides, police added.

82.title: Women engage in fight, pull each other's hair in Thane local; video surfaces
82.article_body: An argument between two women on board Thane-Panvel local train turned violent after they started thrashing each other. A video of the incident that reportedly took place on Wednesday evening has surfaced on social media. The women are seen pulling each other's hair and raining slaps on each other in the video.

83.title: 60-yr-old woman dies after falling into open drain in Delhi's Dwarka
83.article_body: A 60-year-old woman fell into an open drain in Delhi's Dwarka on Wednesday, police said. The incident took place at around 7:00 pm in Sector 13 near a Reliance Fresh outlet. The woman, identified as Sudha Devi, was taken to a hospital where she passed away, police said. A case has been registered for causing death by negligence.

84.title: ₹8.81 crore fine collected from traffic violators in Gurugram till August 2022
84.article_body: Gurugram Traffic Police said they have collected ₹8.81 crore as fines from around 8 lakh traffic violators between January and August this year. As per police, most of these challans have been issued for driving in the wrong direction, followed by for driving without high-security number plates, no entry, excess seating capacity, dangerous driving, using black films etc.

85.title: Clear Dalit sanitation workers' dues worth ₹16 cr: Delhi L-G to AAP govt
85.article_body: Delhi L-G VK Saxena on Thursday directed the Chief Secretary to clear all dues of Dalit sanitation workers before Diwali. The order came after Dalit Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry cited non-payment of bills to over 1,000 workers to the tune of ₹16 crore by Delhi government. The workers have reportedly not received their dues over last four years.

86.title: Credit Suisse is seeking outside investor for investment bank spin-off: Reports
86.article_body: According to reports, Credit Suisse is trying to bring an outside investor to provide funds for a spin-off of its advisory and investment banking businesses. The bank is looking for advisory and deal-making teams alongside the leveraged finance unit for its new boutique-like firm. Sources said talks on reviving the First Boston name for the spun-out businesses are also advancing.

87.title: Nykaa joins hands with Dubai's Apparel Group for strategic alliance
87.article_body: Indian cosmetics brand Nykaa entered a strategic alliance with Dubai-based lifestyle brand Apparel Group to expand in Gulf countries. Nykaa Chief Executive Falguni Nayar said the two companies will together build a multi-brand beauty retail business in Gulf Cooperation Council countries. Nykaa said that the upcoming festival season has already given a glimpse of consumer demand recovery.

88.title: Govt gets ₹1,203 crore dividend from 5 Central Public Sector Enterprises
88.article_body: The government has received ₹1,203 crore as dividend tranches from five Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSE). The total dividend receipts of the government from CPSEs now stand at ₹14,778 crore in this fiscal. Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey tweeted that SAIL, HUDCO and IREL paid ₹604 crore, ₹450 crore and ₹37 crore respectively.

89.title: Sanju Samson smashes his highest score in ODI cricket
89.article_body: Sanju Samson on Thursday slammed an unbeaten 86 off 63 deliveries in the first ODI against South Africa in Lucknow. It is Samson's highest score in ODI cricket. The 27-year-old wicketkeeper-batter's previous highest score was 54(51), which came against West Indies in July. In his seven ODI innings, Samson has crossed 40 four times.

90.title: False: Tharoor on rumours of him backing out of Congress Prez poll
90.article_body: MP Shashi Tharoor on Thursday stated that rumours of him withdrawing his nomination from the Congress President election are false. "I'm receiving so much support that if I wouldn't have been democratically inclined, I would have asked the other candidate to withdraw," he added. He called the election a "friendly contest". Mallikarjun Kharge is the other candidate for the post.

91.title: I picturise Ravana like this: Adipurush director on comparison of his Ravana with Khilji
91.article_body: Director Om Raut has defended the portrayal of Ravana in 'Adipurush' after many compared Saif's look to Ranveer Singh's Khilji in 'Padmaavat'. Raut said, "The Ravana that we saw earlier was an artistic representation of the evil that Ravana was. My Ravana is demonic too, but in today's time, if I picturise Ravana like this, then that is it."

92.title: 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' becomes fastest film in history to gross ₹100 crore in Tamil Nadu
92.article_body: Mani Ratnam-directorial 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' has created history by becoming the fastest film to gross ₹100 crore in Tamil Nadu box office. The film crossed the ₹100 crore mark in Tamil Nadu within five days of its release, breaking the previous record of seven days set by 'Sarkar' and 'Bigil'.

93.title: Harshad Ribadiya joins BJP days after resigning from Congress
93.article_body: Patidar community leader Harshad Ribadiya joined the BJP on Thursday, two days after resigning from the Gujarat Assembly as a Congress MLA. He was inducted during a function organised at the BJP's state headquarters 'Kamalam'. Several local Congress leaders, including Junagadh district Congress President, Mehsana taluka Congress President and Kisan Morcha leaders, also joined BJP during the event.

94.title: 22 killed as two migrant boats sink off the coast of Greece
94.article_body: Two boats carrying illegal migrants sank off the coast of Greece late on Wednesday night, resulting in the death of at least 22 people with many missing. The two vessels sank hundreds of miles apart. Rescue efforts in one of the incidents saw residents and firefighters pulling out migrants from the edge of steep cliffs.

95.title: 16 killed, 24 injured in bus accident in Nepal
95.article_body: At least 16 people were killed and 24 people were injured in a bus accident in southern Nepal's Bara District on Thursday. At the time of the accident, the bus was transporting people from the Dashain festival in Narayangadh in Chitwan district to Pathlaiya in Bara district. According to reports, the bus was carrying more passengers than its capacity.

96.title: Sonia, Rahul help girl after she falls during Bharat Jodo Yatra
96.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi helped a girl who fell down during the Bharat Jodo Yatra in Karnataka's Mandya on Thursday. Sharing a video of the incident, Congress tweeted, "We care!" The video, which has gone viral on social media, shows Sonia Gandhi giving a back rub to the girl. The child bore a Tricolour in her hands.

97.title: Don't kill or get killed, contribute to Kashmir's development: Athawale to terrorists
97.article_body: Union minister Ramdas Athawale on Thursday appealed to terrorists to neither kill nor get killed and instead contribute to the development of Kashmir. "Kashmir is a beautiful place...The government is trying to boost tourism so that it creates more employment opportunities and benefits the people," he said. He added that Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK) would be part of India "one day".

98.title: Javed Akhtar's 'World needs you in White House' tweet to Michelle goes viral, people react
98.article_body: A tweet by lyricist Javed Akhtar telling ex-US First Lady Michelle Obama that "not only US but the world needs you in White House" went viral. Reacting to it, a user wrote, "What the covfefe is this." Another tweet read, "The confidence I need in...life." "Reminds me of Lalit Modi telling Sushmita Sen to 'reply my SMS'," a user wrote.

99.title: India abstains from voting at UN to debate China's abuse against Uyghur Muslims
99.article_body: India has abstained from voting on a draft resolution in the UN Human Rights Council to debate the human rights situation in China's Xinjiang region. The draft resolution on "holding a debate on the situation of human rights in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China" was rejected after 17 members voted in favour, 19 voted against, and 11 abstentions.

100.title: India lose an ODI on home soil for 1st time in 2022
100.article_body: South Africa defeated India by 9 runs in the rain-curtailed first ODI in Lucknow on Thursday. With this, India suffered their first defeat in ODI cricket on home soil in 2022. South Africa put up a total of 249/4 in their 40 overs and restricted India to 240/8. The match witnessed Sanju Samson register his highest ODI score (86*).

101.title: Hinduphobia has no place in our society: UK's Labour Party leader
101.article_body: UK's Opposition Labour Party leader Keir Starmer has said "Hinduphobia has absolutely no place in our society", as he vowed to end "divisive politics" in the country. "I want to...thank the Hindu community for your contribution to Britain, for everything you do for us," he said. Starmer's comments came following recent communal clashes in Leicester and Birmingham.

102.title: Oil prices at 3-week high as OPEC+ cuts production by 2 mn barrels/day
102.article_body: Oil prices jumped to three-week high on Thursday after Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies agreed to cut oil production by two million barrels/day. Brent crude futures jumped by 0.9% to $94.25 per barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude was up 0.9% at $88.55 per barrel. Reportedly, the production cut will go into effect from November.

103.title: Tiger enters MANIT campus; classes shifted to online mode
103.article_body: A tiger entered the campus of Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology (MANIT) in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh on Thursday, forcing classes to be held in the online mode. MANIT Registrar Binod Doley said the Forest Department officials had spotted the tiger's pugmarks. He said cages were set up and cameras were installed to monitor the tiger's movements.

104.title: 3 gather on hilltop for online study, struck by lightning in Odisha
104.article_body: Three school students aged between 17-18 were struck by lightning on Wednesday after they gathered on a hilltop for online study owing to poor internet connectivity at Mundagam village, Odisha. Their parents found them in an unconscious state on the hilltop near Mundagam. They're currently in a hospital. Kandhamal's Chief District Medical Officer Manoj Upadhyay said their condition is stable.

105.title: Bihar man tied to tree, beaten to death by villagers for raping 9-yr-old
105.article_body: A man in Bihar's Katihar was tied to a tree and beaten to death by villagers for allegedly raping a nine-year-old girl. The accused silently took the girl to an isolated spot while she was sleeping with her mother in her house. He was caught red-handed when the girl's mother and villagers reached the spot after hearing her cries.

106.title: 3 to 4 farmers commit suicide in Maharashtra everyday: Ajit Pawar
106.article_body: Former Maharashtra minister Ajit Pawar on Thursday claimed three to four farmers were committing suicide in the state everyday since the new government led by CM Eknath Shinde came to power. He further accused the government of not declaring a wet drought in some parts of the state. The Nationalist Congress Party leader was addressing a gathering in Baramati.

107.title: Cattle movement curbs to continue in view of lumpy skin disease: Maha minister
107.article_body: Maharashtra Animal Husbandry Minister Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil on Thursday said that restrictions on cattle movement in Maharashtra will continue for one more month in view of the lumpy skin disease. "Vaccination is going on and we are assessing the situation," Vikhe Patil said. "This vaccination drive has helped us keep the deaths to 2,100," he added.

108.title: 'Cataclysmic' pair of stars that orbit each other in less than an hour discovered
108.article_body: Astronomers have discovered a pair of stars with an extremely short orbit that appear to circle each other every 51 minutes. The system could be a "cataclysmic variable," in which a sun-like star orbits tightly around a white dwarf, a hot, dense core of a burned-out star. In next 70 million years, their orbital period would reduce to 18 minutes.

109.title: Man stabbed after dispute over alleged molestation of girls at garba event in Rajasthan
109.article_body: A man was stabbed after a dispute over alleged molestation of girls during a garba program in Bikaner in Rajasthan, ANI reported. According to Bikaner Police, two accused named Gautam and Sameer Nadsa were arrested while a minor was also detained on the complaint of Madhusudan Modi. The victim is currently in ICU in PBM hospital, reports said.

110.title: BRS has no plans to contest K'taka Assembly polls: HD Kumaraswamy
110.article_body: JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy on Thursday said that Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS), led by Telangana CM KCR, has no intention to contest Assembly polls in Karnataka. BRS may support JD(S) in "15-20 Telugu-speaking" Assembly constituencies in Karnataka bordering Telangana, Kumaraswamy said. Kumaraswamy ruled out any intention to go to national politics and said his strength and fight is in Karnataka.

111.title: AAP releases 4th list of 12 candidates for Gujarat elections
111.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Thursday released its fourth list of 12 candidates for the Gujarat Assembly elections. The party has nominated a retired teacher named Nirmalsinh Parmar from Himatnagar and businessman Doulat Patel from Gandhinagar (South). An industrialist named Kuldeep Vaghela, tribal leader Pankaj Patel and an arts teacher named Dinesh Baria are also included in the list.

112.title: Reflections from Mars not caused due to water: Scientists
112.article_body: Scientists have said that reflections on the surface of Mars under its south pole could be caused by layers of ice and carbon dioxide and not by water. "On Earth, reflections that are bright are often an indication of liquid water, even buried lakes...But on Mars...it should be too cold for similar lakes to form," a researcher said.

113.title: Magna to invest over $120 million for new engineering centre in Bengaluru
113.article_body: Canadian auto parts maker Magna said that it has planned to invest over $120 million to establish a new engineering centre in Bengaluru. Magna said that the facility will serve as a key centre in powertrain electrification, electronics and software-defined vehicle development. The facility is expected to open in the first quarter of next year.

114.title: Heard 'GodFather' is doing well, God bless you: Salman to Chiranjeevi
114.article_body: Actor Salman Khan took to Instagram and posted a video congratulating actor Chiranjeevi on the success of GodFather. "I heard that GodFather is doing really well. Congrats. God bless you," Salman could be heard saying in the video. As per the makers, 'GodFather' collected ₹38 crore worldwide on the first day. Salman has a cameo in the film.

115.title: Amit Shah, JP Nadda to embark on a 3-day visit to Assam from Oct 7
115.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah and BJP chief JP Nadda will embark on a three-day visit to Assam from October 7. The leaders will inaugurate the party's new state office in presence of CM Himanta Biswa Sarma, officials said. "After the function, the leaders will address a rally of BJP...workers at Veterinary College Playground in Khanapara," BJP state president said.

116.title: There should be no ban on anybody: Mammootty on Sreenath Bhasi
116.article_body: Speaking about Malayalam actor Sreenath Bhasi, actor Mammootty has said, "There should be no ban on anybody." This comes after Sreenath was arrested for abusing a woman anchor after which Kerala Film Producers' Association (KFPA) said that they won't cooperate with Sreenath. KFPA's statement was perceived as a ban, but they clarified they don't have the "power" to ban anyone.

117.title: Why is Delhi LG not ordering a probe into ₹6,000-cr MCD scam: AAP
117.article_body: The AAP on Thursday questioned Delhi LG VK Saxena why he hasn't ordered a probe into the alleged ₹6,000-crore scam in Delhi's municipal body. "It's been...two months since Deputy CM Manish Sisodia sent a letter to...LG, along with documents, asking for a probe into the scam," AAP's Durgesh Pathak said, questioning which BJP leader the LG was trying to protect.

118.title: Police AIG arrested in ₹1-crore bribe case in Punjab
118.article_body: The Vigilance Bureau, Punjab on Thursday arrested Assistant Inspector General of Police (AIG) Ashish Kapoor for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹1 crore. Kapoor is presently posted as Commandant, fourth India Reserve Battalion in Pathankot. Deputy Superintendent of Police Pawan Kumar and Assistant Sub-Inspector Harjinder Singh have also been named as accused in the case.

119.title: Shubman Gill creates history, becomes fastest Indian batter to reach 500 ODI runs
119.article_body: India opener Shubman Gill on Thursday created history by becoming the fastest Indian batter to reach 500 runs in ODIs. The 23-year-old reached the 500-run mark during his 7-ball 3-run knock against South Africa in the first ODI. He took 10 innings to reach the milestone. The previous record was held by Navjot Singh Sidhu, who took 11 innings.

120.title: Withdraw rule that makes 6 airbags mandatory in passenger cars: IRF to Gadkari
120.article_body: International Road Federation (IRF) has urged Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari to withdraw the notification making six airbags mandatory in passenger cars from October 2023. IRF said this rule should be made mandatory once 85% of the people start wearing rear seat belts. "Unless people start wearing rear seat belts, the provision of six airbags will become counterproductive," it said.

121.title: It is going to be better this time: Rashmika Mandanna on 'Pushpa 2'
121.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna, speaking about 'Pushpa: The Rule', has said that the film will be "better and bigger". "It is going to start once 'Goodbye' releases, very soon. It is going to be better this time," she added. The film also features Allu Arjun and will be the sequel to the 2021 film 'Pushpa: The Rise'.

122.title: Hackers stole $399 million worth of crypto globally in Q3 2022: Report
122.article_body: A bug bounty platform Immunefi has found the world saw cryptocurrency losses of up to $428 million in Q3 2022. According to Immunefi, fraud accounts for only 7% of the total losses, while hacks account for 93% of the losses. Hackers reportedly stole $399 million worth of crypto. The two most targeted chains in Q3 were BNB Chain and Ethereum.

123.title: 2 men detained under Public Safety Act in J&K's Samba
123.article_body: Two alleged criminals, Vikas Slathia and Akshay Sharma, were detained under the Public Safety Act (PSA) in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba, the police said. The district magistrate formally issued their detention order under the PSA after dossiers of their repeated criminal activities were presented. The police added that many criminal cases were registered against them over the past decade.

124.title: Baghel inaugurates 'Chhattisgarhiya Olympics' to boost traditional sports
124.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Thursday inaugurated 'Chhattisgarhiya Olympics', which will have 14 types of traditional sports and will continue till January 6, an official said. The event is being held at Balbir Singh Juneja Indoor Stadium in Raipur. "The CM...tried his hand at a few traditional games...like 'langdi', 'bhaura', 'bati' and 'pitthul' to motivate participants," the official said.

125.title: Kuldeep Yadav recreates 'perfect' delivery from 2019 World Cup, ICC shares videos
125.article_body: India Chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav recreated his 'perfect' delivery from 2019 World Cup to dismiss South Africa's Aiden Markram in first ODI in Lucknow. Kuldeep bowled Markram with a delivery that turned back into the batter significantly. Three years ago, he had dismissed Babar Azam in a similar fashion at World Cup and had termed his delivery as "perfect".

126.title: If Congress wanted 'Bharat Jodo', why didn't they abrogate Art 370: Munda
126.article_body: Union Tribal Affairs Minister Arjun Munda on Thursday claimed that the Congress wants to gain political mileage in the name of strengthening the nation. "The character of Congress has been well assessed by the people...If [Congress] really wanted 'Bharat Jodo'...why did not they abrogate Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir?" he said. Congress launched 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' last month.

127.title: Fossil of cat-sized reptile, an early relative of flying reptile, found in Scotland
127.article_body: A fossil of a cat-sized reptile that was closely related to an extinct group of flying reptiles known as pterosaurs has been unearthed in Scotland. Named Scleromochlus taylori, the reptile lived on Earth about 240 to 210 million years ago. Scleromochlus had a large head, a long tail, a short neck, and a slender body, and stood on spindly legs.

128.title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan launches anti-drug campaign
128.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has launched a month-long "no to drugs" awareness campaign and asked people from all walks of life to come together to remove all contraband from state. "We cannot waste even a second. We have to win this fight against drugs," Vijayan said. Special programmes will be held in schools and colleges as part of the campaign.

129.title: Toxic air pollution particles found in lungs, brains of unborn babies for the first time
129.article_body: Air pollution particles have been found in developing lungs and brains of unborn babies for the first time, a study by University of Aberdeen and Hasselt University in Belgium stated. Thousands of black carbon particles were found in each cubic millimetre of tissue, which were breathed in by mother during pregnancy and then passed through bloodstream and placenta to foetus.

130.title: 1.62 crore tourists visited J&K since January 2022, highest in 75 years: Govt
130.article_body: Around 1.62 crore tourists have visited Jammu and Kashmir since January 2022, the Union Territory government said on Thursday. The Directorate of Information and Public Relations (DIPR) of the J&K government said the tourist footfall in the Union Territory this year is the highest since India's independence, reported news agency ANI.

131.title: Waaree Energies raises ₹1,000 cr through investor funding
131.article_body: Solar panel manufacturing company Waaree Energies has raised ₹1,000 crore through investor funding. The firm withdrew its Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP) filed with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) last year, owing to the funding round. The company was founded in 1989 by Hitesh Mehta and it recently reported a turnover of ₹2,000 crore.

132.title: Stay away from WhatsApp, it's been a spying tool for 13 yrs: Telegram Founder
132.article_body: Messaging service Telegram's Founder and CEO Pavel Durov in a note on Telegram said, "You can use any messaging app you like, but do stay away from WhatsApp – it has now been a surveillance tool for 13 years." He added, "Every year we learn about some issue in WhatsApp that puts everything on their users' devices at risk."

133.title: Partha Chatterjee's custody extended till Oct 19 in WB SSC scam case
133.article_body: A special CBI court has extended the judicial custody of ex-West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee till October 19 in connection with the School Service Commission recruitment scam case. The court has also sent three other ex-officials, including ex-WBBSE president Kalyanmoy Ganguly, to judicial custody till October 19. All four accused will be produced before the court again on October 19.

134.title: Give ₹3,000 to common people for Diwali: Congress to Maha govt
134.article_body: Congress state chief Nana Patole has asked Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde to deposit ₹3,000 in the bank accounts of common people of the state for Diwali. "The people suffering from inflation should get relief!" he tweeted. In a letter to Shinde, Patole said the state government's Diwali package of ₹100 for ration card holders is "too small" for a family.

135.title: Haryana sends cough syrup samples to lab after WHO alert on Gambia deaths
135.article_body: Haryana has sent samples of four cough syrups manufactured by Sonipat-based Maiden Pharmaceuticals Limited to a Kolkata lab for testing after WHO potentially linked them to the death of 66 children in Gambia. "Action...will be taken once the [lab] report comes," Haryana's Health Minister Anil Vij said. Notably, the concerned syrups aren't sold in India.

136.title: Never going to happen: Big B's granddaughter Navya on becoming actress
136.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda, speaking about her plans to become an actress, said, "I think that dream is, unfortunately, going to be unfulfilled for many people." She said she keeps reminding people that she's an entrepreneur and that her becoming an actress is never going to happen. Navya's brother Agastya Nanda will make his debut in 'The Archies'.

137.title: 300 transgender artistes to be part of Sushmita's 'Taali': Report
137.article_body: Around 300 transgender artistes will reportedly be part of Sushmita Sen's upcoming web series 'Taali'. A source stated, "The show will require 25-50 trans artistes every day. A total of 300 transgender artistes have been hired for pivotal crowd scenes that will be shot over the next month." Sushmita will play transgender activist Gauri Sawant in the series.

138.title: 2 drug peddlers arrested, 156 gm heroin recovered in Meghalaya
138.article_body: The Meghalaya Police arrested two drug peddlers in East Khasi Hills district and over 156 grams of heroin was recovered from them, CM Conrad Sangma tweeted on Thursday. "Our war against drug trafficking is on!" he tweeted. The police also seized two smart phones, one vehicle and ₹1.28 lakh cash from the accused during the operation.

139.title: CM Eknath Shinde read BJP's script at Dussehra rally: Maha Cong chief
139.article_body: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole took a jibe at Eknath Shinde, saying that the CM is "BJP's puppet" who read its script during the Dussehra rally at the Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC) ground on Wednesday. "We will not tolerate Shinde, his Ministers and MLAs repeatedly criticising the Congress to cover the sin of their rebellion," Patole said.

140.title: Porsche becomes Europe's most valuable automaker, valued at €85 bn
140.article_body: Porsche overtook parent company Volkswagen to become Europe's most valuable carmaker as its market valuation reached €85 billion. After falling below the listing price on Monday, Porsche's shares rose as investment banks bought 3.8 million shares for €312.8 million as part of the company's greenshoe option. Measures taken to stabilise Porsche's share price were seen as part of the IPO.

141.title: Zerodha's billionaire CEO shares his 5 healthy habits including 12 hrs of fasting
141.article_body: Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath shared five habits that made him healthier after a Twitter user asked for the same. "Dinner & killing all devices 2 hours before sleep. Yoga Nidra or some form of meditation for 10 minutes before sleep...12 hours of fasting at least," tweeted Kamath. "Setting daily activity goals on Apple Watch...Protein before a drink," he added.

142.title: Kuldeep Yadav sledges David Miller after he misses delivery, video goes viral
142.article_body: Team India Chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav sledged South Africa batter David Miller after the latter missed his delivery which turned sharply during the first ODI in Lucknow. Kuldeep was seen saying something to Miller following the delivery. The incident happened in the 24th over of South Africa's innings. Kuldeep registered figures of 8-0-39-1 in the match.

143.title: How to retweet it more than once: Shamsi on pic of ground dimensions used for 3rd T20I
143.article_body: South Africa spinner Tabraiz Shamsi retweeted a picture of ground dimensions used for third India-South Africa T20I in Indore. "Surely an international ground...should have bigger boundaries than 55 metres," the original tweet read. Shamsi wrote, "Does anyone know of a way which can allow me to retweet this more than once...Let's make cricket an even contest between bat and ball."

144.title: 2,500 positions in police department will be filled soon: Punjab CM
144.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said 2,500 positions in the police department will be filled soon. The new recruitments will include 1,156 constables (intelligence and investigation cadres), 787 head constables (investigation cadre) and 560 sub-inspectors (intelligence and investigation in district and armed police cadres). Mann said tests for the recruitments will be held later this month.

145.title: Will respond to Rahul Gandhi's letter on injured elephant: Bommai
145.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that he will respond to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's letter about an injured elephant calf at the Nagarahole Tiger Reserve, on humanitarian grounds. Rahul Gandhi wrote to Bommai, seeking intervention to provide timely treatment to the injured elephant calf. Bommai said he would speak to forest officials and ensure that treatment is given.

146.title: SEBI asks Brickwork Ratings to shut operations in 6 months
146.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) asked Brickwork Ratings to wind down operations within six months stating "failure to exercise proper skill, care and diligence, while discharging its duties as a credit rating agency". SEBI instructed the agency to not take on fresh clients or new mandates from now. Brickwork is one of seven SEBI-registered credit rating agencies.

147.title: 12 more bodies recovered from Uttarakhand's Draupadi ka Danda-2 peak
147.article_body: A total of 12 bodies of trainees were recovered from the Draupadi ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi on Thursday after an avalanche hit the mountain on Tuesday, said Nehru Institute of Mountaineering. With this, the total death toll of the incident has reached 16, including two instructors. Over 20 mountaineers are still believed to be missing.

148.title: For first 10 days in 'Chup', I kept thinking I'll get fired: Shreya
148.article_body: Actress Shreya Dhanwanthary revealed that she kept thinking that she will get fired from R Balki's 'Chup' for the first 10 days of the shoot. "I kept thinking that they will realise that they made a mistake, that I don't know anything and will let me go," she added. Shreya stated Balki had more faith in her than herself.

149.title: Vicky Kaushal's father posts 21-year-old photo of actor with Shah Rukh, pic goes viral
149.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal's father and action director Sham Kaushal has shared a 21-year-old photo of his sons, Vicky and Sunny, posing with Shah Rukh Khan on the sets of film 'Asoka'. Shershaah director Vishnu Vardhan, who worked as an assistant director in 'Asoka', is also seen in the photo. "Vicky was studying in 8th standard," Sham Kaushal wrote.

150.title: Raj woman strangles husband to death to get ₹50 lakh insurance, loan money
150.article_body: A 47-year-old woman in Rajasthan's Nagaur allegedly strangled her husband to death to claim an insurance amount and avail of a loan waiver of ₹50 lakh. The accused, Sharda, was reportedly also engaged in a property dispute with her husband over the last three years. Sharda and her husband engaged in an altercation on Tuesday, after which she strangled him.

151.title: 3 Hindu Munnani functionaries threaten beef stall worker in TN; arrested
151.article_body: Police have arrested three Hindu Munnani functionaries for threatening a beef stall employee in Tamil Nadu's Periyanaickenpalayam on Tuesday. The three functionaries, who were allegedly in an inebriated state, had threatened the employee against operating the stall. They were arrested based on a complaint by the stall's owner, who was not present at the stall when the incident happened.

152.title: Security arrangements made for Durga idol immersion in Hyderabad
152.article_body: Elaborate security arrangements have been made for immersion of Durga idols in Hyderabad, which will start on Thursday evening and continue till the early hours of Friday. Police expect around 6,000 idols to be immersed in the Hussain Sagar lake. Rapid Action Force (RAF) teams are deployed at MJ Market, Siddiamber Bazar, Charminar and Lal Darwaza to help local police.

153.title: Google Chrome is most vulnerable browser in 2022: Report
153.article_body: A new report by Atlas VPN has revealed that with 303 vulnerabilities in 2022, Google Chrome is the most vulnerable browser so far this year. It's also the all-time leader, with 3,159 cumulative vulnerabilities since its inception. It's followed by Mozilla Firefox, with 117 vulnerabilities, and Microsoft Edge, with 103 vulnerabilities. Apple's Safari browser documented 26 vulnerabilities in 2022.

154.title: ₹8.81 crore fine collected from traffic violators in Gurugram till August 2022
154.article_body: Gurugram Traffic Police said they have collected ₹8.81 crore as fines from around 8 lakh traffic violators between January and August this year. As per police, most of these challans have been issued for driving in the wrong direction, followed by for driving without high-security number plates, no entry, excess seating capacity, dangerous driving, using black films etc.

155.title: Women engage in fight, pull each other's hair in Thane local; video surfaces
155.article_body: An argument between two women on board Thane-Panvel local train turned violent after they started thrashing each other. A video of the incident that reportedly took place on Wednesday evening has surfaced on social media. The women are seen pulling each other's hair and raining slaps on each other in the video.

156.title: Any role that anybody gets is because Leo DiCaprio passed on it: Bale
156.article_body: Actor Christian Bale has said that any role that anybody gets is because Leonardo DiCaprio passed on it. "All those people that I've worked with multiple times, they all offered every one of those roles to him first," he added. Bale further stated, "So, thank you, Leo, because literally, he gets to choose everything he does."

157.title: 17-yr-old boy stabbed with a knife in Delhi after fight on Dussehra
157.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was stabbed to death after a fight with a group in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Wednesday during Dussehra celebrations. The deceased had gone to watch Ramlila when he got into a fight with a group of people. He collapsed in a pool of blood with the knife still stuck in his chest while the attackers escaped.

158.title: People visit Ujjain flyover for selfies before 'Mahakal Lok' opening
158.article_body: Ahead of the 'Mahakal Lok' opening, Ujjain's Hari Phatak Overbridge has turned into a 'selfie point' as everyday people can be seen gathering near the parapet and taking photos. "People of Ujjain are super excited about the new corridor," a resident of the city said. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the new corridor on October 11.

159.title: India urges New Zealand to be 'fairer' over student visa issue
159.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar interacted with his New Zealand counterpart Nanaia Mahuta on Thursday and raised the issue of visa delays being faced by Indian students. Some students had to leave New Zealand due to COVID-19 and couldn't get the opportunity to get their visas renewed. Jaishankar said he urged a fairer and more sympathetic treatment for these students.

160.title: Man stabbed to death at Hyderabad's Edi Bazaar
160.article_body: A man was stabbed to death by a group of people in Hyderabad's old city area on Tuesday. The victim, identified as Syed Baqtiyar Agha Qureshi, had come to meet some people near Anmol Hotel at Edi Bazaar where he was attacked with sharp-edged weapons and died on the spot. The police shifted the body to the Osmania Hospital mortuary.

161.title: Hawkers assault 52-yr-old woman on bridge of Thane railway station
161.article_body: A 52-year-old woman was assaulted on the bridge of Thane railway station after she had an altercation with some hawkers whose merchandise was displayed in a manner that was impeding the movement of people. "A group of hawkers hit her and also outraged her modesty," a railway police official said. The accused have been booked, he added.

162.title: Scores of flights cancelled in Germany as Eurowings' pilots go on strike
162.article_body: Scores of flights were cancelled in Germany on Thursday as pilots of domestic carrier Eurowings went on a strike. The pilots have demanded better pay and more rest hours between flights. By Thursday morning, more than 150 flights were cancelled across German cities. Around 30,000 passengers are expected to be affected by the strike.

163.title: Expression of interest invited for Future Retail's insolvency resolution process
163.article_body: The resolution professional of Future Retail (FRL) has invited 'expression of interest' from prospective buyers under the ongoing Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process. All interested and eligible prospective applicants (PRA) for FRL will have to submit an expression of interest for the resolution plan by October 20. The resolution professional will issue the final list of PRAs on November 6.

164.title: Rupee drops 32 paise to close at all-time low of 81.94 against US dollar
164.article_body: The Indian rupee declined by 32 paise to close at a record low of 81.94 against the US dollar on Thursday. At the interbank foreign exchange market, the local currency opened at 81.52 and witnessed an intra-day high of 81.51 against the American currency. Earlier, on Tuesday, the rupee appreciated by 20 paise to end at 81.62 against the dollar.

165.title: Acid-like chemical sprayed at girl in MP's Durga puja pandal; 10 arrested
165.article_body: A group of men reportedly sprayed an acid-like or inflammable chemical on a girl at a Durga puja pandal in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Tuesday. Police have arrested 10 persons in the case. While they are trying to ascertain the motive behind the attack, it's not clear if the girl was the actual target or not. She has been hospitalised.

166.title: China to increase coercion after Prez Xi assumes 3rd term: Taiwan
166.article_body: Taiwan's Minister of Mainland Affairs Council Chiu Tai-san on Thursday said Beijing will increase its coercion and intimidation tactics against the island after Chinese President Xi Jinping assumes a third term in office. China considers Taiwan as its own territory. Chiu said Beijing's work in relation to Taiwan has entered a phase of so-called 'anti-independence and promoting reunification'.

167.title: Ex-DC spinner Lamichhane arrested on landing in Nepal in 17-yr-old girl's rape case
167.article_body: Former Nepal captain and former Delhi Capitals spinner Sandeep Lamichhane was arrested immediately upon landing in Nepal's Kathmandu on Thursday in 17-year-old girl's rape case. In a video shared by Kantipur TV on Twitter, the 22-year-old can be seen being escorted in police custody. The 17-year-old girl had accused Lamichhane of raping her at a hotel in Kathmandu.

168.title: My role was mine: Mouni on if her role was better than Alia's in Brahmastra
168.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy was asked about her role being better than Alia Bhatt's in 'Brahmastra'. To this, she replied, "Why are you asking me such controversial questions? My role was mine. My responsibility was to play the antagonist...that's what I focussed on and that's what I did." Mouni played Junoon in the film, which also featured Ranbir Kapoor.

169.title: Very happy to have support of young people in the party: Shashi Tharoor
169.article_body: Talking about the party's Presidential Poll, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said he feels very happy to have the support of young people in the party. "I'm not turning away any support, be it young or old," he said. "We need everyone to join us in this adventure of making a rejuvenated Congress to lead young India," he added.

170.title: Pathankot residents paste posters of 'missing' MP Sunny Deol on houses, cars
170.article_body: Several posters of BJP's Gurdaspur MP Sunny Deol were pasted by people on walls of houses, vehicles and railway stations in Punjab's Pathankot which read "gumshuda ki talaash" (searching for a missing person). "After becoming [the] MP, [Deol hasn't] visited Gurdaspur. He...hasn't brought any industrial development [here]...If he doesn't want to work, he should [resign]," a protesting local said.

171.title: Investors get ₹7.6 lakh cr richer in 2 trading sessions as Sensex rallies
171.article_body: Investors' wealth rose by ₹7.6 lakh crore in two trading sessions as market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms rose to ₹275.9 lakh crore on Thursday. BSE Sensex, which rose over 1,400 points in the last two trading sessions, closed 156.63 points higher at 58,222.10 on Thursday. ICICI Bank, Infosys, ITC and Reliance were among the top contributors to Sensex's rise.

172.title: DCW seeks action-taken report over 11-yr-old's rape inside Delhi school
172.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) on Thursday sought an action-taken report from Delhi Police on alleged rape of an 11-year-old girl by two senior students inside a Delhi school's washroom in July. She had allegedly reported the matter to a teacher but school authorities didn't refer it to Delhi Police. DCW has sought details of arrests made by October 10.

173.title: Deepak Nirula of ice cream and fast food chain Nirula's passes away at 70
173.article_body: Deepak Nirula, the son of Madan Gopal Nirula, who made the fast food brand 'Nirula's' famous across north India, passed away at 70 on Tuesday. The family sold the brand name to Navis Capital Partners in 2006. "Thank you for giving us our first pizza, our first burger, our first ice-cream parlour experience," an Instagram post by Nirula's said.

174.title: Microsoft may invest $100 mn in Indian gaming firm Zupee: Report
