174.article_body: Microsoft is in talks to invest over $100 million in Indian online gaming platform, Zupee, as per a report. The report added that the deal may not go through as Microsoft thinks that Zupee's pay-to-win service may be seen as gambling. If the deal goes through, Zupee will reportedly use Azure and other Microsoft cloud services.

175.title: My wife doesn't write as many love letters to me as you do: Kejriwal to Delhi L-G
175.article_body: Taking a jibe at Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that even his wife doesn't write as many love letters to him as he does. "My wife doesn't scold me as much as L-G sahib does every day," Kejriwal tweeted in Hindi. L-G sahib, chill a little, he further said.

176.title: 45-year-old female journalist dies in road mishap in Bengaluru
176.article_body: A 45-year-old female journalist died and her husband was injured after their scooter was hit by a truck on Bengaluru's Hebbal Flyover on Tuesday. The deceased journalist was identified as CR Latha, who worked for a Kannada news TV channel. The truck is reported to have grazed the scooter, following which Lata fell under the truck.

177.title: US-led military exercises provoked North Korea: Russia, China at the UN
177.article_body: Russia and China on Wednesday told the United Nations (UN) that military exercises led by the US had provoked North Korea into test firing missiles. The United Nations Security Council was debating on how to respond to North Korea which launched a ballistic missile over Japanese territory. The session ended without an agreement on what the next steps should be.

178.title: HC orders probe in linkage of sewage & stormwater drains in B'luru
178.article_body: The Karnataka High Court (HC) has ordered a probe to ascertain which agency allowed connecting an underground drainage system from a residential layout to a stormwater drain in Bengaluru Urban district. The investigation will be led by an officer of the rank of a Deputy Commissioner of Police or above. The court said adverse effects of this connection include waterlogging.

179.title: World Bank cuts India's growth forecast to 6.5% for 2022-23
179.article_body: The World Bank, in its twice-a-year report on South Asia, cut its growth forecast for India to 6.5% year-on-year for 2022-23, from earlier estimates of 7.5%. It further warned that the Russia-Ukraine war and global monetary tightening will affect the economy. "Private investment growth is likely to be dampened by heightened uncertainty and higher financing costs," the World Bank said.

180.title: Rain disrupts electricity supply in parts of Hyderabad
180.article_body: After heavy rains lashed Hyderabad on Thursday, electricity supply in various parts of the city was impacted. Telangana State Southern Power Distribution Company Limited took to Twitter to announce that power supply will be restored soon. Sriram Nagar, Srinagar Colony and Indira Nagar faced power cuts for nearly an hour. A yellow alert was issued by the IMD for Hyderabad.

181.title: Man arrested for smuggling ₹27-crore gold watch studded with diamonds at Delhi airport
181.article_body: The Delhi Customs have arrested an Indian national at IGI airport on his arrival from Dubai for allegedly smuggling seven luxury wrist watches, including one Jacob & Co watch made of gold and studded with diamonds worth ₹27 crore. Besides the watches, a diamond-studded gold bracelet and an iPhone 14 Pro 256 GB was also recovered from the passenger.

182.title: Crowd at Maha CM's rally showed which is real Shiv Sena: Fadnavis
182.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that the "huge" crowd at CM Eknath Shinde's Dussehra rally in Mumbai showed who leads the real Shiv Sena. "There was a huge gathering at the BKC ground whose capacity is the double of that of Shivaji Park (where Uddhav Thackeray spoke), and the BKC ground was filled to the brim," Fadnavis said.

183.title: Cong's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will have no impact: K'taka CM Bommai
183.article_body: The Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which is currently passing through Karnataka, "will have no impact", CM Basavaraj Bommai said on Thursday. "Naturally all party leaders will work for their own party, she (Sonia Gandhi)...walked for half-a-kilometer and gone, it's okay," Bommai said. He rejected claims that BJP was planning state-wide tours of its leaders to counter the Congress' yatra.

184.title: BJP MP Pragya Thakur appears before court in Malegaon blast case
184.article_body: BJP MP Pragya Singh Thakur, a prime accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, appeared before a Mumbai trial court on Thursday. Her lawyer cross-examined an official of the Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad who had arrested her. Thakur, who initially sat on the wooden bench assigned for the accused, was allowed to sit on a chair after she complained of backache.

185.title: 19-yr-old held for stabbing sanitation employee to death in Thane
185.article_body: A 19-year-old man, Monish Dilip Jadhav, was arrested for stabbing a 40-year-old sanitation employee of Bhiwandi Nizampur City Municipal Corporation (BNCMC) to death at her house in Thane, police said. The accused was the neighbour of the deceased Savita Shivram Salve and was robbing her house when he was caught red-handed. Jadhav then stabbed her and escaped from the house.

186.title: Work on flyover at Pune University junction may start next week
186.article_body: The Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) has planned to start the work on the multi-level flyover at the Pune University junction next week. Earlier, the PMRDA had declared that the work on the flyover will start in September and later said that it would start on Friday. However, it again postponed it on PMC's request due to traffic issues.

187.title: Ranbir wants me to get back to work soon after baby's birth: Alia Bhatt
187.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has revealed that her husband and actor Ranbir Kapoor wants her to go back to work soon after their baby's birth. "He...said in an interview...'I have this very big responsibility...to send Alia back to work because the fans would really complain...hold me responsible if I don't do my bit as a parent as well'," she stated.

188.title: My 1st pay cheque was ₹7,000 when I had no bank account: Sidharth Malhotra
188.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra revealed his first pay cheque was for ₹7,000 and added that he had no bank account when he received the cheque. Speaking about his acting aspirations as a child, Sidharth said that his family never took him seriously. "It was...in my late teens I started facing still cameras and all and then that whole thing," he added.

189.title: India, Indonesia debt outperforms China despite global selloff
189.article_body: According to reports, the sovereign debt of India and Indonesia lost 0.4% and 1.5% respectively for dollar-based investors in the third quarter, less than other emerging Asian markets including China. The Rupiah and the Rupee have the widest spreads in emerging Asia, offering investors relief from global market volatility. China hasn’t seen the scale of foreign inflows observed last year.

190.title: Ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav on 'life-saving' drugs: Medanta Hospital
190.article_body: Gurugram's Medanta Hospital on Thursday claimed that former UP CM and Samajwadi Party leader Mulayam Singh Yadav is on "life-saving" drugs. "He is being treated in the ICU by a comprehensive team of specialists," the hospital said. Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday reached the hospital to enquire about Yadav's health.

191.title: India will do whatever it can for Ukraine crisis' solution: EAM
191.article_body: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar on Thursday said that India is willing to do whatever it can to facilitate a solution to the Ukraine crisis. He said it is natural that different countries and different regions would react a little differently when it comes to Ukraine. Jaishankar said this during his interaction with Auckland Business Chamber's CEO Simon Bridges.

192.title: SEBI may start criminal prosecution of market offenders: Report
192.article_body: The central government in consultation with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) is looking to allow the market regulator to initiate criminal prosecution of market offenders, according to a report. Presently, SEBI can not prosecute offenders and can only initiate proceedings against them in any court of the country. It can, however, pass penalty orders against these offenders.

193.title: Not selling anything in India: Indian firm behind syrups linked to 66 deaths in Gambia
193.article_body: Indian cough syrup manufacturer Maiden Pharmaceuticals is "not selling anything in India", the company's director Naresh Kumar Goyal told Reuters. He added that the company is trying to find out from its buyer in Gambia details related to the deaths of 66 children which the WHO said may have been linked to its products.

194.title: 26-yr-old man arrested with 'Meow Meow' drug worth ₹1 lakh in Pune
194.article_body: Pune Police's Anti-Narcotic Cell arrested a 26-year-old man with 6.9 grams of mephedrone or 'Meow Meow' drug worth ₹1 lakh. "We're looking at...supply chain and distribution network of the suspect," a police officer said. "Primary probe suggests...he used to buy the contraband from a dealer in Mumbai and had been selling it in Pune in small packets," he added.

195.title: Alia Bhatt shares pictures with Ranbir Kapoor from her baby shower
195.article_body: Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to share pictures with actor-husband Ranbir Kapoor from her baby shower. "Just...love," she wrote in the caption of the post. Two of the pictures show the Bhatt and the Kapoor families while another picture shows Alia with some of her friends, including Akansha Ranjan Kapoor. The baby shower was held at Alia and Ranbir's home.

196.title: He should apologise to nation: Anil Vij over Udit Raj's remark on Prez
196.article_body: Reacting to Congress leader Udit Raj's "chamchagiri" remark on President Droupadi Murmu, Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij said that Raj should apologise to the nation for his statement. "Udit Raj's statement is shameful. Droupadi Murmu has become President after winning the election," Vij said. "He is insulting the democratic system, he is insulting a tribal woman," he added.

197.title: CCI must fairly address global mergers and acquisition issues: FM Sitharaman
197.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the Competition Commission of India must "fairly and squarely" address issues arising out of cross-country mergers and acquisitions. She added that CCI should pay attention to Indian law and its evolution keeping fair trade and competition in mind. "It should also be cognisant of what is developing in different parts of the world," she said.

198.title: Walked half-a-km and gone: K’taka CM on Sonia Gandhi joining Bharat Jodo Yatra
198.article_body: After Congress chief Sonia Gandhi joined party's Bharat Jodo Yatra on Thursday in Karnataka, CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "She has walked for half-a-km and gone." Speaking about the yatra, he said, "Naturally, all party leaders will work for their own party...As far as we're concerned, we have nothing to do with it and it doesn't make any impact."

199.title: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel gets environmental clearance for Hazira plant expansion
199.article_body: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India announced it has received environment clearance for expansion of its plant in Hazira to 15 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) from the current crude steel capacity of 9 MTPA. The company said government's National Steel Policy would receive a big boost from the project. The venture will also help the company's own long-term capacity expansion ambitions.

200.title: SEBI nod for IPOs worth ₹5,000 crore to expire this month
200.article_body: Approvals given by SEBI for IPOs worth ₹5,000 crore are set to lapse in October as four firms have delayed the issue launch amid tough market conditions.  The companies are One Mobikwik Systems, Skanray Technologies, Penna Cement Industries, and ESAF Small Finance Bank. According to experts, Paytm owner One97 Communications' disappointing listing was another reason for the delay.

201.title: 3 killed as car skids off, falls 50 feet down in Uttarakhand’s Bageshwar
201.article_body: A car skidded off a road and fell 50 feet down in Uttarakhand's Bageshwar on Thursday, leading to the death of three people. Police said one person, who was injured in the accident, has been admitted to the hospital. The four people were on their way back home after a Ramleela show when the driver lost control over the car.

202.title: 'Citadel' India set in 90s, series to go on floors by Nov end: Report
202.article_body: The Indian version of 'Citadel', starring Varun Dhawan and Samantha Ruth Prabhu, is reportedly set in the 1990s and will go on floors by the end of November or early December. Varun and Samantha will reportedly start their workshops for the Raj and DK directorial series by early November. It's expected to premiere by the second half of 2023.

203.title: 3 SP leaders write to Akhilesh, seek to donate kidney to Mulayam Singh
203.article_body: Three Samajwadi Party (SP) Councillors from Bareilly have written a letter to party chief Akhilesh Yadav expressing their will to donate a kidney to Mulayam Singh Yadav. The 82-year-old MP is in the ICU of Gurugram's Medanta hospital. Gaurav Saxena, Shamim Ahmed and Raees Mian Abbasi said donating a kidney to him would be a matter of pride for them.

204.title: Vintage cars on display to promote wildlife protection in B'luru
204.article_body: To create awareness about wildlife week, the Karnataka Forest Department called vintage car and motorcycle owners to promote the idea of preserving things from the past in Bengaluru. The vehicle owners held a rally at the Vidhana Soudha. Wildlife week is observed from October 2 to October 8 to create awareness among people about the importance of wildlife protection.

205.title: Mountaineering, trekking banned in Uttarkashi till Oct 8 over bad weather alert
205.article_body: Uttarkashi District Magistrate Abhishek Ruhela has said that trekking and mountaineering activities have been banned in Uttarkashi district from October 6-8. His decision came after the meteorological department issued an alert for rain and snowfall in the region. Recently, 10 trainee mountaineers were killed in an avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarkashi.

206.title: Scooby-Doo's Velma is a lesbian, confirms new Halloween movie
206.article_body: Scooby-Doo's Velma Dinkley has been confirmed as a lesbian in 'Trick or Treat Scooby-Doo!'. It shows Velma's character having a crush on Coco Diablo, a new character who plays the head of a costume crime syndicate. To mark the moment, Google has added a feature in which pride flags and confetti appear if one searches for any Velma-related term.

207.title: New Vande Bharat Express hits herd of buffaloes, front part of engine damaged; pic surfaces
207.article_body: The recently inaugurated Vande Bharat Express running between Mumbai Central and Gandhinagar met with an accident on Thursday, after a herd of buffloes came on the tracks. The incident occurred between Vatva station to Maninagar in Gujarat. The accident damaged the front part of the engine, said Western Railway Senior PRO JK Jayant.

208.title: There was no Hindu religion during Rajaraja Cholan's period: Kamal Haasan
208.article_body: Speaking about 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', Kamal Haasan has said that there was no such thing as "Hindu religion" during the reign of Rajaraja Cholan. "There was Vainavam, Shivam and Samanam...the Britishers gave us that name (Hindu) as they didn't know how to refer to us collectively," he added. Recently, filmmaker Vetrimaaran objected to portraying Rajaraja Cholan as a Hindu king.

209.title: Shami is somebody the opposition do fear: Steyn on Bumrah's replacement
209.article_body: Ex-South Africa pacer Dale Steyn has said he has written down Mohammad Shami's name as Jasprit Bumrah's replacement for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "As [Bumrah's] replacement, I'd look at someone who can qualify with similar experience. Shami is probably the guy I would go with," stated Steyn. "Shami's somebody the opposition do fear," he added.

210.title: BJP's fall in next poll begins: Jairam during Bharat Jodo Yatra in K'taka
210.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Thursday, during the Congress' ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra in Karnataka, said, "The response we have garnered from a BJP-ruled state in Karnataka shows that the countdown for BJP's fall in the next election has begun." Congress chief Sonia Gandhi also joined the yatra today in Karnataka. The Karnataka leg of the march began on Friday.

211.title: BEST to begin premium bus service by mid-October in Mumbai
211.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) is set to launch a premium bus service by mid-October to reduce the number of cars on city roads. "The premium bus service will run with 100 buses in the fleet till December," Lokesh Chandra, General Manager of BEST, said. Users will be able to book their tickets through Chalo app, he added.

212.title: Nobel Prize in Literature awarded to French author Annie Ernaux
212.article_body: The 2022 Nobel Prize in Literature has been awarded to French author Annie Ernaux. She has been given the award "for the courage and clinical acuity with which she uncovers the roots, estrangements and collective restraints of personal memory", a tweet read. Her writing "examines a life marked by strong disparities regarding gender, language and class", said Nobel Prize's website.

213.title: 3 kids die, 11 hospitalised after eating at children's home in Tamil Nadu
213.article_body: At least three children died and 11 others were hospitalised due to suspected food poisoning after they consumed food at a children's home in Tamil Nadu's Tiruppur. Following dinner on Wednesday, some children vomited while others had dysentery. Their condition deteriorated after they had breakfast on Thursday. The deceased, who died without responding to treatment, were aged between 10-13 years.

214.title: I almost joined McKinsey before starting Bhanzu: World's fastest human calculator
214.article_body: Neelakantha Bhanu Prakash, the 22-year-old known as the world's fastest human calculator, almost joined McKinsey before starting his math learning startup Bhanzu. "I started out at IIIT Hyderabad...dropped out...went to Delhi's St Stephen's College and started teaching and doing stage shows at the age of 17," he said. Founded in 2020, Bhanzu investors include CRED's Kunal Shah and comedian Biswa.

215.title: Lloyd's of London detects 'unusual activity', probes possible cyberattack
215.article_body: Insurance company Lloyd's of London has said it is investigating a possible cyberattack after the firm detected "an unusual activity on its network". "As a precautionary measure, we are resetting the Lloyd's network and systems. All external connectivity has been turned off, including Lloyd's delegated authority platforms," a spokesperson said. Around 100 insurance syndicates operate at Lloyd's.

216.title: Pay ₹10 lakh to kins of men who died inside sewer: Delhi HC to DDA
216.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed Delhi Development Authority (DDA) to pay ₹10 lakh each to the families of two men who died after inhaling toxic gases inside a sewer in Mundka area last month. "It is very unfortunate that even after 75 years of independence, poor people are being forced to work as manual scavengers," the High Court observed.

217.title: RTI activist injured, son killed by man accused of illegal mining in Guj
217.article_body: A man, accused of illegal mining, allegedly rammed his car into the scooter of a Dalit RTI activist who was with his 23-year-old son in Gujarat's Kutch on Monday, police said. The activist was seriously injured and his son succumbed to his injuries, police added. The activist had filed complaints of illegal mining against the man around a year ago.

218.title: 1,300 kg marijuana seized from 2 drug peddlers in Hyderabad, held
218.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested two interstate drug peddlers and seized 1,300 kg marijuana from them. Along with the contraband, the police also seized a vehicle and two mobile phones, all worth ₹2.80 crore, they stated in a press release. The accused regularly transported marijuana from Andhra Pradesh's East Godavari district to Telangana, Madhya Pradesh and other states, police stated.

219.title: Pak don't have a no. 4, fans leave stadium once openers get out: Ex-player Aaqib
219.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed has said their current side doesn't have a batter like Virat Kohli in their middle order and that's why they should experiment by bringing captain Babar Azam at number four position. "They don't have any player for number four...You are completely dependent on the openers. If they get dismissed, fans leave the stadium," added Aaqib.

220.title: Samsung's Q3 profit may fall by 25%, the first in 3 years: Report
220.article_body: Samsung Electronics' third-quarter profit could reportedly decline by 25%, the first year-on-year fall in nearly three years, according to a Refinitiv SmartEstimate. This could be driven by a fall in demand for electronic devices and the chips that power them due to rising inflation. Samsung's operating profit has likely fallen to 11.8 trillion won ($8.3 billion) in the July-September quarter,

221.title: Agritech startup FALCA raises $3 mn in Pre-Series A funding round
221.article_body: Agritech startup FALCA has secured more than $3 million in a Pre-Series A funding round led by Inflection Point Ventures. The funding round also saw participation of LetsVenture, Mumbai Angels, along with other high-net-worth individuals. The startup was founded in 2018 by Santosh Danegoudar. The company said that it is currently working with 1,00,000 farmers.

222.title: Suspected of being child lifters, 3 ‘sadhus’ beaten in Chhattisgarh
222.article_body: A mob beat up three men dressed like 'sadhus' in Chhattisgarh's Durg district on Wednesday, said police. The people suspected them to be child thieves after they were seen speaking to some children at a Dussehra fair, said police. The victims, who hailed from Rajasthan, sustained minor injuries and were treated at a local hospital.

223.title: Driver was distracted as he was plugging charger: Police on Mumbai accident that killed 5
223.article_body: The accused in Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link accident, identified as Irfan Abdul Raheem Beelkia, has been arrested by the police. The interrogation of the accused revealed he was trying to plug in his mobile phone charger and lost sight of the road ahead, police said. A total of five persons were killed and eight others were injured in the accident.

224.title: Pics of liquor bottles surface after CM Shinde’s Dussehra rally in Mumbai
224.article_body: Yuva Sena, the youth wing of Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, shared pictures of liquor bottles and garbage, a day after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's Dussehra rally. The pictures are of Mumbai University's Kalina campus, which provided the parking facility for the event. Yuva Sena workers shared images of liquor bottles, thrown-away food and have demanded action against the organisers.

225.title: Local trains hit due to snag at Mumbai's Sandhurst Road station
225.article_body: Suburban train services were disrupted on Thursday due to a technical snag in overhead wires at south Mumbai's Sandhurst Road station. The snag, which occurred at about 1:00 pm, resulted in trains heading towards Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus being held up. Affected services have been diverted to the fast line and restoration work is in full swing, Central Railway said.

226.title: Electronics Mart India's IPO subscribed 6 times on day 2
226.article_body: Electronics Mart India's initial public offering (IPO) was subscribed six times on Thursday, the second day of bidding, as the participants bought 37.42 crore equity shares against the offer size of 6.25 crore shares. Retail investors subscribed 6.98 times, while non-institutional investors bought 8.08 times the portion. Qualified institutional buyers subscribed 2.67 times the reserved portion.

227.title: Shameful: NCW chief on Cong leader's 'chamchagiri' remark on Prez
227.article_body: National Commission for Women (NCW) Chairperson Rekha Sharma has criticised Congress leader Udit Raj after he said, "No country should get President like Droupadi Murmu. Chamchagiri also has its limits." "[Raj's] statement is not just against a woman but a constitutional head of government," the NCW chief said. "Comments made are condemnable. The derogatory language used is shameful," she added.

228.title: Solomon Islands won't be used by foreign military: Sogavare to Aus PM
228.article_body: Solomon Islands PM Manasseh Sogavare met his Australian counterpart Anthony Albanese in Canberra. "Solomon Islands will not do anything that will undermine our national security...will never be used for foreign military installations," Sogavare reportedly said. A joint statement issued by Albanese's office said the two leaders discussed bilateral ties, climate change and aspirations for Pacific.

229.title: SpiceJet shares jump 9% after report of ₹1,000 crore government loan
229.article_body: Shares of SpiceJet jumped by 9% on Thursday following reports of the airline likely receiving an additional loan of ₹1,000 crore under the government's modified Emergency Credit Line Guarantee Scheme. According to reports, the funds will help the airline clear its dues and induct new Boeing 737 Max planes. SpiceJet is currently operating less than 50% of its approved flights.

230.title: 19-year-old traces bike, catches thieves in 90 minutes in Navi Mumbai
230.article_body: A 19-year-old boy, along with his cousin, traced his stolen bike and caught the thieves within 90 minutes in Navi Mumbai. After the boy found his bike missing, he rushed to nearby petrol pump, assuming the thieves must have gone there as the bike didn't have enough petrol. When they reached there, they saw the thieves leaving and caught them.

231.title: I would love to see Umran Malik unleashed in Australia: Brett Lee
231.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee has said India's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik and Australia's 23-year-old all-rounder Cameron Green should've been part of their respective teams for the upcoming 2022 T20 WC. "I'd love to see Umran unleashed in Australia...[and] I can't fathom how Cameron isn't in [Australia's] team," he stated. Umran picked 22 wickets in his 14 games in IPL 2022.

232.title: Akasa Air to allow pets on board, bookings to begin from Oct 15
232.article_body: Newly launched airline Akasa Air said passengers can carry pets on board from November, the bookings for which will begin from October 15. One pet per person with weight of up to 7 kgs will be allowed, and domesticated cats and dogs have to be in a cage to board the flight. The pricing for this has not been disclosed.

233.title: Struggled between life, death for 3hrs: U'khand avalanche survivor
233.article_body: Deep Thakur, an Uttarakhand avalanche survivor recounted the experience after being rescued from Draupadi's Danda Peak in Uttarkashi. Thakur said the avalanche came suddenly, following which he and his companions fell into the crevasses about 60 feet deep and struggled between death and life for about three hours. Deep was among the 41 mountaineers who were stuck in the avalanche.

234.title: Gold prices in India surge to highest level in nearly 2 months
234.article_body: Gold rates on Thursday were the highest since August 16 as the Indian benchmark indices rose amid subdued dollar and Treasury yields. On the Multi Commodity Exchange, gold prices were up by 0.51%, touching ₹51,910 per 10 grams around 10:20 am. Gold prices also rose globally. Spot gold was up 0.4% at $1,722.09 per ounce in the initial trade.

235.title: Seen very few marriages work, would like to disprove that: Ali Fazal
235.article_body: Actor Ali Fazal said he's seen "very few marriages work" in his life, which is something he'd like to "disprove" in his relationship with Richa Chadha. The actor, who recently got married to Richa, said he shares "something spiritual" with the actress. "I thank her for that because she's made me more spiritually aware than I was before," he said.

236.title: Pune Zilla Parishad sets up 'inspection unit' to monitor public works
236.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad has set up a Development and Scheme Inspection Unit to monitor the implementation of public works and welfare schemes. "The unit will have six staffers...With the help of Pune ZP's software system that allows contractors to fill up daily updates on work progress, it will monitor the progress of all public works," an official said.

237.title: 12,000 Meta employees may lose jobs amid 'quiet layoffs': Report
237.article_body: Meta, formerly Facebook, is undergoing "quiet layoffs" that could affect 15% or around 12,000 employees of the company's workforce, Insider reported citing several employees. Meta's executives reportedly told directors across the company to select at least 15% of their team to be labelled as "needs support". These employees will be put on a performance improvement plan and eventually let go.

238.title: Mumbai man sentenced to 10-year jail for raping minor daughter for 7 years
238.article_body: A man in Mumbai was sentenced to ten years in jail for raping his minor daughter for seven years. The accused worked on a ship in Saudi Arabia and visited his family every two months. In 2014, his wife noticed that their daughter avoided him and the girl told her that she was sexually assaulted by her father many times.

239.title: Mumbai's Charni Road's old foot-over bridge to be shut for 45 days
239.article_body: The old foot-over bridge (FOB) of Charni Road station of Mumbai Suburban Railway will be closed for 45 days till November 18 owing to construction work, according to Western Railway. The FOB will be closed for constructing a link connecting the newly constructed foot over-bridge and platforms 2 and 3. Both spans of the existing FOB will be dismantled.

240.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st ODI against South Africa
240.article_body: India captain Shikhar Dhawan won the toss and elected to bowl first in the first ODI against South Africa. The match has been reduced to 40 overs per side contest due to rain delay. Batter Ruturaj Gaikwad and leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi are making their ODI debut for India. India's playing XI also includes Sanju Samson, Ishan Kishan and Kuldeep Yadav.

241.title: Mumbai reports more than 100 COVID-19 cases for 2nd straight day
241.article_body: According to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, Mumbai reported 127 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, taking the overall tally to 11,50,828. This comes a day after the city recorded 155 COVID-19 cases. No fresh death due to the infection was recorded on Wednesday, while 116 patients recovered in the last 24 hours. The number of active COVID-19 cases in Mumbai is 795.

242.title: Twitter to now let users post tweets with different media formats
242.article_body: Twitter is rolling out a new feature that lets users combine three media formats (GIFs, photos, videos) in a single tweet on both Android and iOS devices. "This feature will roll out globally...with a chance to see mixed media Tweets on the web," Twitter said. Users can also rearrange their media's layout while composing a tweet, it added.

243.title: Roblox enabled a girl's sexual and financial exploitation: Lawsuit
243.article_body: A lawsuit has accused Roblox of enabling a girl's sexual and financial exploitation by adult men in US' California. The lawsuit claims that the victim came in contact with adult men through Roblox, who encouraged her to use Discord, Snapchat and Instagram. They then exploited her by encouraging her to abuse prescription drugs and send sexually explicit photos of herself.

244.title: 16-kg heroin worth ₹80 crore seized at Mumbai airport, flyer arrested
244.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrested an airline passenger with drugs at Mumbai airport following a tip-off on Wednesday. The DRI seized 16 kg of heroin valued at more than ₹80 crore from his luggage. The accused, who is a resident of Kerala, revealed that a foreign national had given him $1,000 as commission to take him to India.

245.title: Shocking incident: Thai PM as 34 people killed in shooting at daycare
245.article_body: Thailand PM Prayut Chan-o-cha called the mass shooting at a daycare centre on Thursday that killed at least 34 people, including 22 children, a "shocking incident". The PM has ordered all agencies to urgently treat the wounded. The gunman was a former police officer and he reportedly took his own life following the shooting in Nong Bua Lamphu province.

246.title: WhatsApp's Beta update blocks screenshots of 'View Once' messages
246.article_body: In its latest Android Beta update, WhatsApp has introduced a feature that enables blocking screenshots and screen recordings of 'View Once' messages. CEO Mark Zuckerberg said, "'View once' is already...popular way to share photos...that don't need to have a permanent digital record. Now WhatsApp is enabling screenshot blocking for 'View Once' messages for an added layer of protection."

247.title: Cong stoops to new low: BJP leader over Udit Raj's 'chamchagiri' remark on Prez
247.article_body: BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla criticised Congress leader Udit Raj over the latter's "chamchagiri" remark on President Droupadi Murmu. "Ajoy Kumar called President Droupadi Murmu as evil and then Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury used the term 'Rashtrapatni', now Congress stoops to a new low!" Poonawalla tweeted. "Udit Raj uses unacceptable language for the first woman Adivasi President," he added.

248.title: 2 arrested for stealing phones worth ₹70 lakh from Hyd Bajaj store
248.article_body: The Rachakonda Police has arrested two persons who allegedly stole as many as 432 cellphones worth ₹70 lakh from a Bajaj Electronics store in Hyderabad in September. Police found three persons wearing face masks entering the store in CCTV footage. The main accused was arrested from Jharkhand's Sahibganj district, while another from West Bengal.

249.title: Batters are to be blamed: Pak Women captain Maroof after defeat vs Thailand
249.article_body: After suffering their first-ever defeat against Thailand in women's T20I history, Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof said their batters are to be blamed for the loss in their Asia Cup match. "Our batters [didn't show] intent...130+ could've been a good total and as a captain, I'm disappointed," added Maroof. Thailand restricted Pakistan to 116/5 and won the match by four wickets.

250.title: 'Ekk Deewana Tha' was mistake, shouldn't have done it: Director
250.article_body: Filmmaker Gautham Vasudev Menon, who directed 'Ekk Deewana Tha', said the 2012 film was a mistake. The film was a remake of the Tamil film 'Vinnaithaandi Varuvaayaa'. Gautham stated the original film was "naturally organic film". Speaking about making a remake of it, he said, "I shouldn't have done that...Somebody asked me 'Did you direct 'Ekk Deewana Tha'?'...I said no."

251.title: UAPA invoked against 15 PFI activists arrested during NIA raids in B'luru
251.article_body: Bengaluru City Police invoked the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) against 15 Popular Front of India (PFI) activists. The accused were arrested on September 22 following raids by the National Investigation Agency (NIA). "UAPA has been invoked in the case against the accused on account of the involvement of a few in crimes in the past," police said.

252.title: 4 men hit 3 policemen with car, beat them with rods in Gurugram hospital
252.article_body: Three police personnel were injured after a group of four men attacked them in a private hospital in Gurugram, officials said on Wednesday. The accused tried to hit them with their car and later beat them with sticks and iron rods, police said. Police reached the hospital after a brawl broke out when the accused refused to pay for medicines.

253.title: 11-yr-old gets trapped inside lift in Gr Noida, rescued after 45 mins
253.article_body: An 11-year-old boy got trapped inside a lift in Greater Noida's Paramount Emotions society for almost 45 minutes before he was rescued by his parents. CCTV footage of the kid playing inside the lift went viral on social media, in which the boy can be seen pushing the lift buttons and inserting a bottle in between the lift doors.

254.title: I'm sitting with my grandfather & talking about periods, it's progress: Navya
254.article_body: Navya Naveli Nanda said it's a sign of progress as she discussed menstruation on a public forum in the presence of her grandfather Amitabh Bachchan. "It's a sign of life...That's not something...we should be ashamed of, or shy away from," she stated. "Menstruation has been a taboo for a long time, but there has been progress," said Navya.

255.title: Wife expressing desire to work after marriage isn't cruelty: Bombay HC
255.article_body: The Bombay High Court has ruled that if a wife expresses a desire to go to work after marriage, it would not amount to cruelty. The HC said this while dismissing a man's plea for divorce on grounds of cruelty. "The marital life should be accessed as a whole and few isolated instances....will not amount to cruelty," the court added.

256.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
256.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs till October 10. Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Meghalaya may witness it across the next four days. It is very likely over Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi and Maharashtra on October 8 and 9. Gujarat may witness it from October 8 to 10.

257.title: US believes Ukrainians behind killing of Russian nationalist's daughter: Report
257.article_body: United States intelligence agencies believe that parts of Ukrainian government were behind a car bomb attack that killed Darya Dugina, daughter of Russian President Vladimir Putin's ally, Alexander Dugin, the New York Times reported. It mentioned that US took no part in the attack and was not aware of it. Russia had accused Ukraine's secret service of orchestrating the attack.

258.title: Gujarat govt launches scheme to attract ₹12.5 trillion investments
258.article_body: Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel unveiled a scheme for attracting investment of ₹12.50 trillion and creating at least 15 lakh jobs in the next five years under Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Schemes for Assistance to Industries. Patel said that the scheme is aimed at encouraging youth to innovate and become job creators as well as de-risking their investments through incentives.

259.title: Rahul kneels down to tie Sonia Gandhi's shoelaces during Bharat Jodo Yatra, pic viral
259.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi joined the Karnataka leg of the Bharat Jodo Yatra on Thursday. Congress MP Shashi Tharoor shared a photo on Twitter showing Rahul Gandhi kneeling next to his mother Sonia Gandhi to tie her shoelaces during the yatra in Karnataka. Tharoor wrote, "Even if she breathes, it also has prayers, Mothers do not break, mothers are mothers!"

260.title: Thailand defeat Pak in a women's T20I for 1st time ever, celebration video goes viral
260.article_body: Thailand defeated Pakistan by four wickets in the league stage of Women's Asia Cup T20 2022 on Thursday. With this, they registered their first-ever victory against Pakistan in women's T20I cricket history. Thailand restricted Pakistan for 116/5 and chased down the target in 19.5 overs. A video of their celebration has gone viral on social media.

261.title: Bihar man detained after threat to 'blow up' Antilia, kill Ambanis
261.article_body: Mumbai Police have detained a man from Bihar in connection with threat calls to Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani's family. On Wednesday, two calls were received at Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital in Mumbai, threatening to blow up the hospital and Ambani's residence Antilia. The caller also threatened to kill Mukesh Ambani, Nita Ambani, Akash Ambani & Anant Ambani.

262.title: World's currency reserves shrink by a record $1 trillion this year
262.article_body: The global foreign-currency reserves have declined by about $1 trillion, or 7.8%, this year to $12 trillion, the biggest drop since Bloomberg began keeping a record in 2003. The decline comes amid the central banks of India and the Czech Republic's intervention to support their own currencies. India's reserves have slumped by $96 billion this year to $538 billion.

263.title: Persistent Systems gains after JPMorgan upgrades stock to 'overweight'
263.article_body: After brokerage house JPMorgan upgraded the call on shares of Persistent Systems Limited to 'overweight' from 'neutral', its stock gained on Thursday. JPMorgan gave a revised target price of ₹4,100 apiece. The Pune-headquartered company is JPMorgan's only 'overweight' within the Engineering, Research and Development space. At 1:52 pm, its shares were trading 6.81% higher at ₹3,522 on the BSE.

264.title: Man's Apple Watch overheats, makes crackling sounds and then explodes
264.article_body: An Apple Watch Series 7 overheated, made "crackling sounds" and then "exploded" just as he was throwing it out the window, its owner claimed in a statement in 9to5Mac. The device's owner visited the emergency room because of lead poisoning concerns. Apple arranged a pickup for the affected device, saying it would take the device to its lab for investigation.

265.title: Pic of gunman who killed 34 people including 22 kids at Thailand daycare released
265.article_body: Thailand's Central Investigation Bureau has released a picture of the gunman, an ex-police officer, who killed 34 people including 22 kids at a daycare centre. Media reported that the gunman later shot and killed himself. Mass shootings are rare in Thailand even though the rate of gun ownership is high compared with some other countries in the region.

266.title: Poland says it's in talks to host US nuclear weapons amid Russia threat
266.article_body: Poland has spoken to the US about having NATO's nuclear weapons on its territory, Polish President Andrzej Duda said amid growing fears that Russian President Vladimir Putin could resort to using nuclear arms in Ukraine. However, deploying US nuclear weapons to Poland, a neighbour of Ukraine, could be a violation of NATO's Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty and the NATO-Russia Founding Act.

267.title: Prithvi Shaw's name should've been there for SA ODIs: Aakash Chopra
267.article_body: Reacting to Prithvi Shaw's omission from the three-match ODI series against South Africa, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said the 22-year-old's name should have been there in the squad. "I frankly see Shaw playing in the next T20 World Cup...Management should start inducting him and utilising him. His numbers are fantastic in domestic cricket," stated Aakash.

268.title: Virgin Atlantic halts London to Hong Kong flights after nearly 30 years
268.article_body: British airline Virgin Atlantic has decided to suspend Heathrow to Hong Kong service, shut its Hong Kong office after nearly 30 years of operation due to prolonged closure of Russian airspace. "Significant operational complexities due to the ongoing Russian airspace closure have contributed to the commercial decision not to resume flights in March 2023," airline founder Richard Branson said.

269.title: Won't allow screening of 'Adipurush': BJP spokesperson Ram Kadam
269.article_body: BJP spokesperson Ram Kadam has said that the screening of 'Adipurush' won't be allowed as it has "distorted the Hindu gods and goddesses". "Some film producers to earn publicity and money have this habit of distorting facts, but the Hindu society will not tolerate such things," he said. Previously, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra also raised objections against 'Adipurush'.

270.title: Australia proposes changes in privacy policy after Optus data breach
270.article_body: Australian government has proposed changes in consumer privacy rules after a data breach at the country's second-largest mobile operator, Optus, compromised personal details of almost 10 million customers. The amendment will let telcos share government-issued identification data with banks for enhanced monitoring for affected users. Banks will have to destroy data when it is no longer required.

271.title: India's services sector growth hit 6-month low in September: PMI
271.article_body: India's services sector activity fell to a six-month low in September at 54.3, the S&P Global India Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) showed. "September also saw a broad stabilisation of input cost inflation...slowest upturn in prices charged for the provision of services since March," Economics Associate Director Pollyanna De Lima noted. In August, PMI stood at 57.2.

272.title: Reflects their anti-tribal mindset: Sambit Patra on Cong leader's remark on Prez
272.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra criticised Congress leader Udit Raj over the latter's "chamchagiri" remark for President Droupadi Murmu. "Words used for President Murmu by Congress leader…[are] worrisome, unfortunate," Patra said. "This isn't the first time they have used such words. Congress' Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury did it too. This reflects their anti-tribal mindset," he added.

273.title: 11-yr-old girl watching garba dies in MP, CT scan shows bullet in head
273.article_body: An 11-year-old girl collapsed and started bleeding profusely while watching garba in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Tuesday, said police. She was taken to a hospital where she died. According to the victim's father, the doctor suggested a CT scan, which showed a bullet-like metallic object in her skull. Based on the post-mortem report, police said a bullet had hit her.

274.title: 31 people including kids killed in mass shooting at daycare centre in Thailand
274.article_body: At least 31 people including kids have been killed in a mass shooting at a pre-school daycare centre in Thailand, police said. Police added that the attacker, an ex-police officer, shot and stabbed children and adults and is now on the run. Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha has alerted all agencies to take action and apprehend the culprit, a spokesperson said.

275.title: Fix for wheel issue that caused electric car recall found: Toyota
275.article_body: Toyota Motor said it has found a fix for the defect because of which it had to recall several units of its first electric vehicle in June. The carmaker recalled 2,700 bZ4X sports utility crossovers globally due to a risk of wheels coming loose. Toyota said it would ensure hub bolts were replaced and properly tightened in new cars.

276.title: Cong leader Udit Raj clarifies 'chamchagiri' remark on Prez, calls it his personal view
276.article_body: Congress leader Udit Raj on Thursday said his remarks on President Droupadi Murmu accusing her of "chamchagiri" were personal and didn't represent his party's views. "My statement...is mine & [has] nothing to do with Congress," part of his tweet read. He had earlier accused her of "chamchagiri" after she said "the salt produced in Gujarat is consumed by all Indians".

277.title: 'Bhoot Police' likely to get a sequel, confirms Saif Ali Khan
277.article_body: Saif Ali Khan has confirmed that the makers of 'Bhoot Police' are "very keen to do a sequel". The film, which had a direct-to-OTT release in 2021, starred Saif with Arjun Kapoor, Jacqueline Fernandez and Yami Gautam. "I liked my role in Bhoot Police. It continues to be one of the most watched films on that [OTT] platform," Saif said.

278.title: Gujarat youth slashes girl's face after asking if she had an affair
278.article_body: A youth allegedly slashed a 14-year-old girl's face in Gujarat's Surat after asking if she had an affair with someone. Although the girl replied in negative, he attacked her with a knife. The victim had to undergo surgery and got 17 stitches. According to the victim's mother, the accused had been harassing her daughter for the past three months.

279.title: Sydney records wettest year since records began in 1858
279.article_body: Australia's Sydney has recorded its wettest year since records first began in 1858. Sydney has received about 2,213 mm of rainfall since January, surpassing the previous record of 2,194 mm set in 1950, official data showed. In the past two years, floods have struck Sydney's suburbs three times, forcing tens of thousands of people to flee their homes.

280.title: 66 clinics halted abortions in 15 US states after Roe vs Wade overturned: Report
280.article_body: At least 66 clinics in 15 US states have stopped providing abortions since the country's Supreme Court overturned Roe vs Wade that guaranteed abortion rights to American women, according to the Guttmacher Institute. The number of clinics providing abortions in the 15 states dropped from 79 before June to 13 as of October, all of which are in Georgia.

281.title: Fan breaks down on meeting Dwayne Johnson, actor shares video
281.article_body: Dwayne Johnson shared a video in which a fan couldn't hold back his tears on meeting the Hollywood actor and former wrestler. The video shows Dwayne signing a WWE Championship belt for the fan. "Even my cold, dark soul gets a little emotional when I see people start to break and cry," the actor wrote along with the video.

282.title: Vijay Nair sent to judicial custody till Oct 20 in Delhi liquor policy case
282.article_body: Delhi's Rouse Avenue court has sent the former CEO of event management firm Only Much Louder (OML), Vijay Nair, to judicial custody till October 20 in a Delhi liquor policy case. He was arrested for his alleged role in the irregularities pertaining to the excise policy. Notably, Nair is the communications in-charge of the Aam Aadmi Party.

283.title: We will not rely on others for defence: Taiwan Prez
283.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Wednesday said that Taiwan will not rely on others for its defence. "Taiwan is fully committed to protecting our security...We're also working to adapt our defence strategy to the changing threats we face," she added. China claims democratically-governed Taiwan as its own territory and has vowed to take the island by force if necessary.

284.title: No country should get Prez like Murmu, 'chamchagiri' has its limits: Cong leader
284.article_body: Congress' Udit Raj said "no country should get President like Droupadi Murmu". "Chamchagiri also has its limits. She says 70% of people eat Gujarat's salt. If you live life by eating salt yourself, you'll know," he tweeted. Earlier, President said Gujarat produces 76% of country's salt and it can be said "salt produced in state is consumed by all Indians".

285.title: Rahkeem Cornwall smashes 205* off 77 balls, including 22 sixes, in 20-over match in US
285.article_body: West Indian all-rounder Rahkeem Cornwall smashed an unbeaten 205 off 77 deliveries, including 22 sixes and 17 fours, while representing Atlanta Fire against Square Drive in an Atlanta Open 2022 match. His knock helped his team post a total of 326/1 in their 20 overs. Atlanta Fire went on to win the match by 172 runs.

286.title: India's tallest flag, higher than Pak flag, to be installed at Wagah-Attari border
286.article_body: The country's tallest flag at 418 feet is set to be installed at the Wagah-Attari border by the National Highways Authority of India, an official said. The present 360-feet high flag was installed in March 2017, following which Pakistan had hoisted a taller flag at Wagah check post. The new Tricolour will be 18 feet longer than the Pakistani flag.

287.title: SpaceX launches 52 Starlink satellites hours after launching Crew-5 mission
287.article_body: SpaceX launched 52 Starlink satellites seven hours after launching members of the Crew-5 mission to the space station on Wednesday. The satellites lifted off atop a Falcon 9 rocket from California's Vandenberg Space Force Base. They were deployed about 62 minutes after liftoff. SpaceX now plans to launch the Intelsat G-33/G-34 mission on October 6.

288.title: Harish Kalyan announces engagement to Narmada Udayakumar, shares pics
288.article_body: Tamil actor Harish Kalyan took to his social media accounts to introduce his fiancee Narmada Udayakumar. Announcing his engagement with Narmada, Harish shared that the two will soon tie the knot. "As we embark on a new life journey to explore and reinvent ourselves together, we seek double the blessings and love from you all, now and always," he wrote.

289.title: Apollo, Sixth Street end talks to finance Musk's Twitter deal: Report
289.article_body: Apollo Global Management and Sixth Street have ended talks with Tesla's Elon Musk to finance his Twitter deal, Reuters reported citing sources. Apollo had been looking at ways to support the deal earlier, while Sixth Street investors were looking at providing about $1 billion. Musk has once again proposed to buy Twitter after backing out of a $44-billion deal earlier.

290.title: Former Uber security chief guilty of concealing 2016 data breach
290.article_body: Former Uber security chief Joseph Sullivan has been found guilty of criminal obstruction by a San Francisco jury for concealing a data breach in 2016 from the FTC. Sullivan "worked to hide" the breach from FTC and "took steps to prevent the hackers from being caught", Attorney Stephanie Hinds said. The breach exposed data of 57 million passengers and drivers.

291.title: BMC gives ₹10 cr each to 24 wards for beautification, repair projects
291.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has disbursed ₹10 crore each to all the 24 municipal wards for beautification and repair projects. "BMC has earmarked a total fund of ₹30.5 crore for each ward for carrying out the beautification and repair work on priority. It has disbursed ₹10 crore to complete the pending work, mainly micro-level, at the earliest," an official said.

292.title: Ban 'Adipurush', Lord Ram wrongly depicted in the film: Ayodhya Ram Temple head priest
292.article_body: The head priest of the Ayodhya Ram Temple on Wednesday demanded an immediate ban on the movie 'Adipurush', over the alleged wrong depiction of Lord Ram, Hanuman and Ravana. Making a film is not a crime but they should not be made to create deliberate controversies to hog the limelight, chief priest Satyendra Das said.

293.title: World's oldest dog passes away aged 22
293.article_body: World's oldest dog, Pebbles, passed away from natural causes at her home in Taylors, South Carolina, US with her owners Bobby and Julie Gregory by her side, Guinness World Records said. The Toy Fox Terrier was born on March 28, 2000, in Long Island, New York. Pebbles birthed 32 puppies across three different litters with her late partner, Rocky.

294.title: I see Deepak Chahar being Bumrah's replacement at the T20 WC: Jaffer
294.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said he sees pacer Deepak Chahar being Jasprit Bumrah's replacement for Team India in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "Deepak is getting to play and he is going to play again in the ODIs and it makes sense...He is a quality new-ball bowler, and I do not think he lacks variation," stated Jaffer.

295.title: Tejashwi reaches Medanta Hospital to check on Mulayam Singh's health
295.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday reached Gurugram’s Medanta Hospital to enquire about former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav's health. "There is some improvement in his health. He is in CCU. Met with Akhilesh Yadav and gave him my best wishes," Tejashwi Yadav said. Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar also visited the hospital yesterday to check on Singh's health.

296.title: Ramayan inspires people to protect all living beings: UP CM Yogi
296.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said the Ramayan inspires people to protect all living beings, as the CM fed milk to a leopard cub at Gorakhpur’s Shaheed Ashfaq Ullah Khan Zoological Park. Speaking on the occasion, CM Yogi said human beings will be safe only when they are aware of their responsibilities towards the nature and conservation of animals.

297.title: 2 electrocuted to death in Durga Puja pandal in UP's Barabanki
297.article_body: Two people, including a 17-year-old boy, were electrocuted to death in a Durga Puja pandal in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki on Wednesday, said police. Several other people also received electric shocks. The incident occurred after a wire supplying electricity to the pandal was damaged, according to a villager. The bodies have been sent for post-mortem.

298.title: JSW Energy gains after Maharashtra MoU for hydro pumped storage project
298.article_body: After JSW Energy's wholly-owned subsidiary JSW Neo Energy entered into a Memorandum of Understanding with Maharashtra to set up a hydro pumped storage project (PSP) in the state, JSW Energy stock surged on Thursday. It will set up a 960 MW capacity hydro PSP. At 11:45 am, the company's stock was trading 11.85% higher at ₹328 apiece on the NSE.

299.title: Girl raped, murdered in UP's Mainpuri
299.article_body: A girl was allegedly raped and murdered in the Nagla Shisham village of Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri district, police said on Wednesday. The victim's younger sister saw the body hanging in the house through the window after returning from coaching. She said a person named Pushpendra strangled her sister to death. Their parents were away at the time of the incident.

300.title: Myanmar jails Japanese filmmaker for 10 years for violating laws
300.article_body: A court in military-ruled Myanmar has jailed a 26-year-old Japanese documentary filmmaker, Toru Kubota, for 10 years over violation of sedition and telecommunications laws, a Japanese Foreign Ministry official said. Kubota was arrested in July at a protest in Myanmar's Yangon. A court hearing on allegations of violation of the immigration control law will be held on October 12.

301.title: 26-year-old man arrested with mephedrone worth ₹1.04 lakh in Pune
301.article_body: Pune City Police arrested a 26-year-old man, who works at the shop of a cloth trader, with 6.9 grams of banned drug mephedrone worth ₹1.04 lakh. This comes after police received a tip-off that a man was trying to sell mephedrone in the Dhankawadi area. "We are looking at the supply chain and distribution network of the suspect," police said.

302.title: Sushmita Sen shares pic showing her look as transgender activist Gauri Sawant
302.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen has announced her next web series, 'Taali', where she will play transgender activist Gauri Sawant. "Nothing makes me prouder & more grateful than to have the privilege of portraying this beautiful person & of bringing her story to the world!!" she wrote while sharing her look on Instagram. Marathi filmmaker Ravi Jadhav will direct the series.

303.title: Dean was in tears, Indian team didn't even look her in the eye: Anderson on mankading
303.article_body: England pacer James Anderson has said he doesn't see mankading as a "legitimate dismissal" and termed it a "sneaky way of getting someone out". Talking about the controversy over India's Deepti Sharma mankading England's Charlotte Dean, Anderson said, "They did not even look Dean in the eye." He added, "If there was guilt about the dismissal, then don't do it."

304.title: Mayor, 17 others dead as gunmen attack town in southern Mexico
304.article_body: At least 18 people have been killed after gunmen wearing ski masks opened fire in a municipal hall and a house in San Miguel Totolapan town in southern Mexico on Wednesday, local media reported. Among those killed were town's Mayor Conrado Mendoza and his father, Juan Mendoza, a former Mayor. Photos online showed the hall riddled with bullet holes.

305.title: EPF subscribers can't see interest due to software upgrade: Finance Ministry
305.article_body: The Finance Ministry clarified on Wednesday that Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) subscribers haven't suffered any loss of interest rate. "The interest is being credited in the accounts of all EPF subscribers. However, that is not visible in the statements in view of a software upgrade being implemented by EPFO to account for change in the tax incidence," it tweeted.

306.title: Adult toys found in briefcase that caused bomb scare in Japan
306.article_body: Adult toys were found in a briefcase that caused a bomb scare in Japan's Kakegawa. Police received a call on Wednesday morning about the unattended briefcase in the parking lot of a municipal cemetery, a spokesman said. Local media sent a helicopter to capture the work of the experts at the scene.

307.title: Chiranjeevi's 'GodFather' earns over ₹38 crore worldwide on first day
307.article_body: The team of 'GodFather' announced on Thursday that the film has collected over ₹38 crore at the worldwide box office on the first day of its release. The Mohan Raja directorial, which released on October 5, is a Telugu remake of Malayalam film 'Lucifer'. While the original movie starred Mohanlal in the lead role, the Telugu film features Chiranjeevi.

308.title: I’m nervous, but excited: Rihanna on Super Bowl halftime show 2023
308.article_body: Singer-songwriter Rihanna said she's "nervous, but excited" about headlining the next year's Super Bowl halftime show.  Rihanna confirmed the news of her participation in the Super Bowl halftime show with an Instagram post, which was shared on September 26. The performance will mark her first stage presence after welcoming her son with A$AP Rocky.

309.title: Will fight Lok Sabha, Assembly polls with KCR's BRS: Kumaraswamy
309.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy said that his party JD(S) and Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao's Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) will fight 2024 Lok Sabha and 2023 Karnataka Assembly elections together. Calling for a 'BJP-Congress mukt' political atmosphere in Karnataka, Kumaraswamy said, "Our party welcomes the emergence of TRS as a national party under the name of BRS."

310.title: Thai firm Translucia picks India's Sunovatech for $3 bn metaverse project
310.article_body: Translucia, a subsidiary of T&B Media Global (Thailand), forayed into India by partnering with Sunovatech to create a $3 billion metaverse project. Sunovatech specialises in immersive reality, while T&B Media is run by the Chearavanont family, counted among Asia's five richest families. Digital asset bank Sygnum, Melbourne-based Two Bulls and Chinese firm Black Flame are part of the alliance.

311.title: 1 charred body found in shop after fire in Delhi's Gandhi Nagar market
311.article_body: A charred body was found in a shop after a fire broke out in Delhi's Gandhi Nagar market on Wednesday evening. "The deceased was 19 years old...was an employee and got stuck inside after fire broke out," a Delhi Fire Services official said. "A total of 28 fire tenders are engaged. Fire is now under control," an official said earlier.

312.title: EU lawmaker cuts her hair during speech in support of Iranian women
312.article_body: European lawmaker Abir Al-Sahlani cut her hair during a speech in the EU Assembly in support of Iranian women protesting against Mahsa Amini's death. Amini died on September 16, days after being detained by Iran's morality police over improper hijab. "Until the women of Iran are free, we're going to stand with you," Iraqi-born Al-Sahlani said before cutting her hair.

313.title: 15-yr-old, 2 others drown in Yamuna during Durga idol immersion in UP
313.article_body: Three people, including a 15-year-old boy, drowned in the Yamuna river during Durga idol immersion in two separate incidents in Agra on Wednesday. While the boy drowned in the Sikandra Police Station area, two others, aged 19 and 22, drowned in the New Agra Police Station area, according to police.

314.title: Won't work for Nitish Kumar even if he vacates CM’s chair for me: Prashant Kishor
314.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Wednesday said he would not work for Bihar CM Nitish Kumar even if he "vacates the CM’s chair" for him. "I categorically told CM...I won't work with him even if he makes me his political heir or vacates the chair of CM for me. I said no….I've made a promise to the people," Kishor added.

315.title: 20-yr-old Indian American student killed in US, roommate arrested for murder called police
315.article_body: A 20-year-old Purdue University student was allegedly killed by his roommate overnight with "multiple sharp force traumatic injuries" at a residence hall on the Indiana campus in US. Varun Manish Chheda was killed allegedly by his 22-year-old roommate who is in police custody. His roommate, Ji Min Sha from Korea, called police to report that Varun was dead.

316.title: SA ODIs opportunity for me to keep momentum going for 2023 WC: Dhawan
316.article_body: Team India stand-in captain Shikhar Dhawan has said the three-match ODI series against South Africa is an opportunity for him to "keep the momentum going" for a place in the 2023 ODI World Cup. "I wish to...keep batting well so that I can make it to the team," he added. Dhawan last played in the Zimbabwe ODIs in August.

317.title: Team India squad departs for Australia for T20 World Cup 2022, BCCI shares pic
317.article_body: Rohit Sharma-led Team India squad departed for Australia on Thursday to take part in T20 World Cup 2022. The BCCI shared a group picture of the contingent ahead of the departure, writing, "Picture perfect...Let's do this Team India...@cricketworldcup here we come." Players also took to their respective social media handles to share pictures from Mumbai airport.

318.title: What is an 'everything app' that Elon Musk wants to make?
318.article_body: An "everything app", often referred to as a "super app", that Elon Musk wants to make has been described as Swiss army knife of mobile apps. An everything app offers a suite of services for users such as messaging, social networking, peer-to-peer payments and e-commerce shopping. "Buying Twitter is an accelerant to creating X, the everything app," Musk had tweeted.

319.title: Kohli, ABD are my idols, I've learnt a lot from them at RCB: Rajat Patidar
319.article_body: India batter Rajat Patidar, who received his maiden India call-up for the ODI series against South Africa, has said he has learnt a lot from Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers while playing for RCB in IPL. Patidar added, "IPL gave me confidence...I try focusing on [different formats]...play as per the [situation]." The first India-SA ODI will be played today.

320.title: Spotify buys content moderation firm Kinzen to address safety issues
320.article_body: Audio-streaming platform Spotify has acquired an Ireland-based content moderation tech firm Kinzen to address safety issues. Kinzen, which has been working with Spotify since 2020, focuses on election-related content, misinformation and hate speech. Earlier this year, Spotify faced backlash over "The Joe Rogan Experience" in which the podcaster was accused of spreading misinformation on COVID-19.

321.title: General Electric cuts jobs at onshore wind unit amid restructuring: Report
321.article_body: General Electric (GE) is laying off workers at its onshore wind unit as the company plans to restructure and resize the business, a Reuters report said. The company reportedly notified employees in North America, Latin America, the Middle-East and Africa about the job cuts. The layoffs are likely to affect 20% of the onshore wind unit's workforce in the US.

322.title: India reports 2,529 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 32,282
322.article_body: India reported 2,529 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,468 fresh COVID-19 cases. The active cases in the country now stand at 32,282 following 3,553 recoveries in the last 24 hours. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 2.07%.

323.title: 'Doctor G' is one of the funniest scripts Ayushmann & I have read: Rakul
323.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh said that she and her co-star Ayushmann Khurrana have often discussed that their upcoming film 'Doctor G' is "one of the funniest scripts" they've read. "This film's beauty is that it's not preachy. Our intention is to entertain everyone," she added. Talking about Ayushmann, Rakul said the actor "comes with an abundance of energy".

324.title: Iranian-made drones hit town near Ukrainian capital for the first time
324.article_body: A town located near Ukrainian capital Kyiv was hit by Iranian-made Shahed-136 delta-wing drones, also known as 'kamikaze drones', local officials said. Governor of the Kyiv region, Oleksiy Kuleba, said six explosions had been heard overnight in Bila Tserkva. Dozens of firefighters and rescue workers tried to extinguish fire and assess damage, Kuleba said, adding that one person was injured.

325.title: Maharashtra will see Sena CM once again: Thackeray at Dussehra rally
325.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday said that Maharashtra will see a Shiv Sena Chief Minister again. During the Dussehra rally at Mumbai’s Shivaji Park, former Maharashtra CM Thackeray said, "With your support, I promise you one thing...I will make sure that you will see a Sena Chief Minister once again."

326.title: Partially decomposed body of woman found in gunny bag in Mumbai
326.article_body: A partially decomposed body of a woman, who appeared to be in her mid-20s, was found in a gunny bag in Mumbai's Kurla East on Wednesday. The body, with hands and legs tied with rope, was thrown in a nullah, said police. There were no injury marks on the body except a strangulation mark on the neck, added police.

327.title: 3 men booked for assaulting pet dog and its owner in Bengaluru
327.article_body: Bengaluru's KR Puram Police has booked three men for assaulting a pet dog and its owner. The three men allegedly entered the house of the dog's owner in the Bhattarahalli area and started beating the pet with a stick, police said. This comes after the dog fought with another dog belonging to a man from the victim's neighbourhood.

328.title: Happiest Minds Technologies gets board's nod to raise ₹1,400 cr via equity
328.article_body: The board of Happiest Minds Technologies on Wednesday approved raising of up to ₹1,400 crore through equity or debt bonds. The IT company, which was founded in 2011, reported about 57% surge in consolidated net profit at ₹53.34 crore in the first quarter ended June. Its consolidated revenue from operations was up 34.46% to ₹328.92 crore during the said quarter.

329.title: Man City, Real Madrid secure 3rd straight wins in Champions League, PSG held
329.article_body: Manchester City and Real Madrid defeated Copenhagen and Shakhtar Donetsk respectively in their respective group matches to secure their third straight wins in the Champions League on Wednesday night. PSG, however, were held to a 1-1 draw by Benfica. Notably, Chelsea got their first win in the competition under new coach Graham Potter, defeating AC Milan 3-0.

330.title: Uruli Devachi garbage depot in Pune turned into 'Amrut Van' forest
330.article_body: Once a garbage depot spread over 20 acres, a spot in Pune's Uruli Devachi has been turned into an urban forest, which is expected to be a major tourist attraction in the future. The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has named it 'Amrut Van'. It had planted over 20,000 saplings that have grown into 10-foot-tall trees over the past three years.

331.title: Prabhas' 'Adipurush' poster a copy of our work, says animation studio; shares pics
331.article_body: An animation studio has claimed that a poster of 'Adipurush' is a copy of its work. Vaanar Sena Studios shared its own Lord Shiva poster and compared it with 'Adipurush' poster featuring Prabhas and wrote that the producers must at least credit it. "Such a shame, T- Series should mention the original creator, who developed the artwork," the caption read.

332.title: Electronics Mart India IPO subscribed 1.69 times, issue ends tomorrow
332.article_body: Electronics Mart India's IPO was subscribed 1.69 times on October 4, the first day of the subscription. The offer garnered bids for 10.58 crore equity shares against an offer size of 6.25 crore. Friday is the last day of subscription and the company, which is the fourth-largest consumer durables and electronics retailer in India, expects to raise ₹500 crore.

333.title: Sensex gains 473 points, Nifty above 17,400 in opening trade
333.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the green on Thursday with the Sensex rising 473.55 points to 58,539.02 and Nifty up 140 points to 17,414.30. Infosys, Hindalco Industries, Tata Motors, Coal India and SBI Life Insurance were among the major gainers on the Nifty. Stocks of HDFC Limited and Hindustan Unilever Limited slipped. About 1,732 shares advanced and 415 shares declined.

334.title: 8-month-old Indian-origin baby, parents, uncle who were kidnapped in US found dead
334.article_body: The missing Indian-origin family kidnapped from California, US, earlier in the week has been found dead. Police announced that all four family members – eight-month-old Aroohi Dheri and her parents, 27-year-old Jasleen Kaur and 36-year-old Jasdeep Singh, and the baby's 39-year-old uncle Amandeep Singh – were found dead. "Tonight our worst fears have been confirmed," police added.

335.title: Prabhas, Om Raut celebrate Dussehra at Red Fort, perform Ravan Dahan
335.article_body: Actor Prabhas was in Delhi to celebrate Dussehra. The actor performed Ravan Dahan on Wednesday at Red Fort's Ramlila in the presence of his 'Adipurush' director Om Raut and Delhi's Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal. Prabhas will be seen playing Lord Ram in 'Adipurush', which will also star Kriti Sanon as Janaki and Saif Ali Khan as Lankesh.

336.title: Which are the 4 Indian cough and cold syrups WHO has warned about?
336.article_body: The four Indian cough and cold syrups WHO has warned about include Promethazine Oral Solution, Kofexmalin Baby Cough Syrup, Makoff Baby Cough Syrup and Magrip N Cold Syrup. WHO said the manufacturer, Haryana's Maiden Pharmaceuticals Limited, has not provided guarantees on safety and quality of these products. The syrups have been linked to 66 deaths among children in Gambia.

337.title: Mumbai court discharges man after lab finds baking soda, not drugs
337.article_body: A Mumbai court discharged a man accused in a narcotics case after a forensic lab report showed that the substance seized from him was not any drug but baking soda. The man was accused of carrying 100 grams of mephedrone. The prosecutor opposed the discharge application saying the report was not conclusive but the court allowed it.

338.title: 9, including 5 school children, killed as tourist bus crashes into KSRTC bus in Kerala
338.article_body: At least nine persons, including five school children, were killed and around 40 others were injured after a tourist bus crashed into another bus of the Kerala State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) in Palakkad district on Wednesday night, police said. The deceased also include three passengers of the KSRTC bus and another person a bus employee, police added.

339.title: 4 sanitation workers die while cleaning sewer at Faridabad hospital
339.article_body: At least four sanitation workers, all aged between 25 and 30, died while cleaning a sewer pit at a private hospital in Faridabad on Wednesday, police said. Initially, two workers entered the sewer and fainted after inhaling poisonous gas, police added. "When they didn't return, two more workers went...to rescue them after which they too fell unconscious," police stated.

340.title: 'Ram Setu' features exciting & thrilling action: Akshay Kumar
340.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar shared that his upcoming film 'Ram Setu' features some "exciting and thrilling" action sequences, which gave him an adrenaline rush after a long time. He also informed that the film's trailer will release on October 11. Directed by Abhishek Sharma, 'Ram Setu' marks Akshay's fourth release this year after 'Bachchhan Paandey', 'Samrat Prithviraj' and 'Raksha Bandhan'.

341.title: SA ODIs will help T20 WC standby players to get into groove: Dhawan
341.article_body: India stand-in captain Shikhar Dhawan has said the three-match ODI series against South Africa will help the standby players for the upcoming T20 World Cup to get into the groove. "Who knows they might get a chance...look at this series as preparation," stated Dhawan. Shreyas Iyer, Ravi Bishnoi and Deepak Chahar are the standbys who will feature in SA ODIs.

342.title: Hyderabad Police arrests man for cheating clients through dating app
342.article_body: The Hyderabad Cyber Crime Police has arrested a man from Delhi for allegedly cheating clients through a dating app named Gigolo Playboy Services. The accused set up call centres and hired some girls to talk to the clients through the app, luring them to transfer money, said police. The complainant, one of the clients, transferred over ₹1.5 crore.

343.title: 8 die, several feared missing after flash floods in WB during idol immersion; video surfaces
343.article_body: At least eight people died and several others are feared missing after flash floods hit Mal river in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri during Durga Puja idol immersion. The video of the incident has surfaced online. "We've rescued around 50 people," DM Moumita Godara said. Expressing his condolences PM Narendra Modi said, "Anguished by the mishap during Durga Puja festivities in Jalpaiguri."

344.title: Jaya shouts at fans taking pics with Abhishek during temple visit, video surfaces
344.article_body: A video shows actress Jaya Bachchan getting angry and shouting at fans taking selfies with Abhishek Bachchan during a temple visit in Bhopal. While Abhishek can be seen obliging some of the fans, Jaya can be seen shouting asking them to stay away. "Don't you have no shame?" she can be heard saying in the video.

345.title: 'Thank God' is first script I heard from start to finish: Sidharth
345.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra said the script of 'Thank God' is the first script that he heard from the beginning to the end. The actor, who is looking forward to the film's release, said the Indra Kumar directorial is a "relatable story" and has a "wonderful message by the end". The comedy film also stars Ajay Devgn and Rakul Preet Singh.

346.title: Sonia Gandhi to join Congress’ 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Karnataka today
346.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi will participate in the party’s 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on Thursday in Karnataka. This will be her first participation in the yatra, which began while she was abroad for a medical check-up. The Karnataka leg of the march began on Friday. The yatra will pass through Karnataka for 21 days covering 511 km in the state.

347.title: Video shows the moment man kidnaps 4 Indian-origin people, including 8-month-old, in US
347.article_body: The authorities in US released a video showing the moment four members of an Indian-origin family, including an 8-month-old baby, were kidnapped in US' California.
