The video shows two family members, Jasdeep Singh and Amandeep Singh, being forced out of building with hands zip-tied together. The video later shows the gun-wielding kidnapper leading Jasleen Kaur and her baby into truck.

348.title: Putin orders his government to take control of Europe's largest nuclear plant
348.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday ordered his government to take control of Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, Europe's largest. Russia captured it shortly after invading Ukraine, but Ukrainian staff have continued to operate it. Meanwhile, the chief of Ukraine's state energy agency announced he was taking over the plant.

349.title: North Korea fires 2 ballistic missiles in direction of Japan
349.article_body: North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles into the sea in the direction of Japan on Thursday. This comes after the return of US aircraft carrier USS Ronald Reagan to the region and a UN Security Council meeting in response to North Korea's recent launches. North Korea said the aircraft carrier posed serious threat to the stability of the situation.

350.title: Nigerian regulator sues Meta, seeks $70 mn fine for 'showing unvetted ads'
350.article_body: The Advertising Regulatory Council of Nigeria (ARCON) has filed a lawsuit against Meta and sought $70 million fine for "publishing unauthorised ads". "The continued publication and exposure of various advertisements directed at Nigerian market through Facebook and Instagram...by Meta...without ensuring the same is vetted and approved before exposure is illegal, unlawful," the court filings said.

351.title: Mumbai man misbehaves with daughter-in-law, seeks sexual favours; jailed
351.article_body: A Mumbai court has sentenced a 65-year-old man to three-year rigorous imprisonment for inappropriately touching his daughter-in-law and asking her for sexual favours. He'd asked his daughter-in-law to engage in a particular sexual behaviour with him, as per a pandit's advice, to solve problems happening in their home. The woman had gotten married to his son a few months earlier.

352.title: 24-yr-old delivery rider lies about being robbed in Delhi; arrested
352.article_body: A 24-year-old delivery rider was arrested for allegedly hatching a conspiracy about being robbed in Delhi's Neb Sarai, police said on Wednesday. The accused told the police that he was held at gunpoint and was robbed of ₹31,000, a police official said. The accused hatched the plan after delivering a phone in Neb Sarai, DCP (south) Chandan Chowdhary said.

353.title: Ex-driver kills 86-yr-old woman, robs her of ₹3 lakh in Delhi
353.article_body: An 86-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed to death by her ex-driver, who entered her house and escaped with ₹3,20,000, police said on Wednesday. The accused revealed during interrogation that he was aware of the money, said DCP (outer) Sameer Sharma, adding that he roamed near the house with a knife all day and later stabbed the victim.

354.title: 'Want a casteless society': Thousands of Dalits convert to Buddhism in Delhi
354.article_body: Several thousand Dalits from Delhi-NCR on Wednesday reportedly converted to Buddhism at an event attended by Delhi Cabinet Minister Rajendra Gautam. "[We want]...a casteless society...We don't want our children to be murdered for drinking water from...pots [or] keeping a moustache," one of the attendees told reporters. The event was held at Ambedkar Bhavan in Delhi's Jhandewalan area.

355.title: Thane woman forges marriage papers to get properties worth ₹19 cr, held
355.article_body: A Thane woman was arrested along with two others for allegedly forging her marriage certificate to get ownership of movable and immovable assets worth ₹19 crore belonging to her deceased husband. Anjali Agarwal reportedly forced her husband, Anil Papde, to sign the certificate by threatening to tell everyone about his HIV diagnosis. Agarwal and her accomplices were arrested on Monday.

356.title: Gautam Gambhir-led India Capitals defeat Irfan Pathan-led Bhilwara Kings to win LLC 2022
356.article_body: Gautam Gambhir-led India Capitals defeated Irfan Pathan-led Bhilwara Kings by 104 runs in the final to win Legends League Cricket 2022. Batting first, India Capitals posted a total of 211/7 despite being 21/4 at one stage. Ross Taylor top-scored for India Capitals with 82(41). Bhilwara Kings were bowled out for 107 in 18.2 overs.

357.title: 4 killed as suicide bomber targets Afghan Interior Ministry mosque
357.article_body: At least four people were killed after a suicide bomber struck a mosque inside the Taliban-controlled Afghan Interior Ministry in Kabul on Wednesday. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack. Wednesday's attack follows last week's suicide bombing in Kabul which claimed 35 lives, according to the United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA).

358.title: Turkey to send troops to Qatar for football World Cup security
358.article_body: The Turkish Parliament on Wednesday approved sending its soldiers to Qatar for helping in security arrangements during the football World Cup next month. Former Turkish Defence Minister Fikri Isik said the deployment would include 250 troops and a naval vessel. Further, Turkey has already assured it will send around 3,000 riot police personnel to Qatar during the international competition.

359.title: Completely untrue: Brad Pitt's representative on claims that he choked one of his kids
359.article_body: A representative for Brad Pitt has denied Angelina Jolie's allegations that he choked one of their children and hit another while on a private jet in 2016, stating they are "completely untrue". Jolie had also claimed that Pitt poured beer and red wine on the children. Jolie's lawyers filed the suit in the couple's legal battle over their French winery.

360.title: WI's Kyle Mayers smashes 105-metre six over cover, cricketers react as video  goes viral
360.article_body: West Indies' Kyle Mayers slammed a 105-metre six over cover during the first T20I against Australia. Reacting to a viral video of the shot, former India opener Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "You are not allowed to do this!" Meanwhile, Adam Gilchrist wrote, "I'm sure there has been a better shot in the history of the game...but I just can't remember it!"

361.title: Our rebellion was not betrayal, but a revolt: Shinde on Shiv Sena split
361.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said that the rebellion by him and other Shiv Sena leaders which led to the split in the party wasn't an act of betrayal, but a revolt. He said voters elected Shiv Sena and the BJP in 2019 in Maharashtra, but Uddhav Thackeray betrayed people by joining hands with the Congress and the NCP.

362.title: Indian-origin Vivek Murthy to represent US on WHO Executive Board
362.article_body: Indian-origin Dr Vivek Murthy has been nominated by US President Joe Biden to serve as the country's representative on the World Health Organisation's (WHO) Executive Board. The White House said Dr Murthy will continue his duties as the US Surgeon General alongside his new position. In March 2021, Dr Murthy was confirmed the US' 21st Surgeon General.

363.title: India, EFTA bloc mull resumption of talks on free trade deal: Reports
363.article_body: According to sources, India and the European Free Trade Association (EFTA), which consists of Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway and Switzerland, are planning to resume the negotiations on a Free Trade Agreement (FTA) after a gap of several years. According to officials, Switzerland has been in talks with India for the FTA. India's total trade with EFTA during 2021-22 was $27.23 billion.

364.title: Who are the ICC Player of the Month nominees for September as 3 Indians included?
364.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday announced the Player of the Month nominees for the month of September. Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan, Australia's Cameron Green and India's Axar Patel have been nominated for ICC Men's Player of the Month award, while India's Harmanpreet Kaur and Smriti Mandhana, and Bangladesh's Nigar Sultana have been nominated in the women's category.

365.title: Some became 'Kattappa', betrayed us when I was in hospital: Uddhav
365.article_body: During the Dussehra rally at Mumbai's Shivaji Park, former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray called the rebel Shiv Sena leaders "Kattappa", a character from 'Baahubali' franchise. He said, "The only thing I feel bad and angry about is that when I was admitted to the hospital, the people whom I gave the responsibility (of the state) became 'Kattappa' and betrayed us."

366.title: Ukraine takes first step towards joining OECD economic group
366.article_body: Ukraine took its first step towards joining the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) after the OECD said it could be a prospective member. Secretary General Mathias Cormann said the OECD's 38 members have decided to recognise Ukraine as a prospective member following a request from Kyiv. OECD closed Russia's accession process after it invaded Ukraine in February.

367.title: Video shows new 70,000-square feet Hindu temple inaugurated in Dubai
367.article_body: Industrialist Anand Mahindra shared the video of the Hindu Temple of Dubai, which was officially inaugurated on Wednesday. "I believe this magnificent temple was formally inaugurated today. Auspicious timing. Will make sure to visit it on my next trip to Dubai," he wrote. The 70,000-square feet temple, located in Jebel Ali, has 16 deities.

368.title: EU agrees to impose price cap for Russian oil over Ukraine war
368.article_body: EU officials said that member nations have agreed to impose a price cap on Russian oil and other sanctions after Moscow annexed four Ukrainian regions. The deal includes curbs on exports of aircraft components to Russia and limits on steel imports. EU will also ban the transport of Russian oil by sea to other countries above the price cap.

369.title: Fan mocks Pakistan's Shadab Khan over tweet, asks him to focus on World Cup; he responds
369.article_body: A fan mocked Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan over his tweet thanking his teammate Iftikhar Ahmad for birthday wish. "Ye shaddy shoody k chakr choro and please focus on World Cup," the fan wrote. Shadab, who's currently in New Zealand, responded, "It's late night in NZ...Physio has asked us to rest...Should I hang upside down and start training if you want?"

370.title: Video of boy doing cricket commentary in Sanskrit goes viral, PM says 'Heartening to see'
370.article_body: A video of a boy doing cricket commentary in Sanskrit during a gully cricket match has gone viral on social media. Prime Minister Narendra Modi also shared the video, tweeting, "This is heartening to see…Congrats to those undertaking this effort." Meanwhile, a Twitter user wrote, "What lovely flow and spontaneity. Sanskrit is a great language."

371.title: I am under house arrest: Ex-J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti
371.article_body: Former CM of erstwhile Jammu and Kashmir Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday claimed she was under house arrest and was stopped from travelling to Pattan. “Was finally allowed to leave my residence only because the HM (Amit Shah) has headed back to Delhi,” she later tweeted. Meanwhile, Srinagar Police said “no restriction of any kind” was placed on Mufti’s travel plan.

372.title: Lee releases video on how cricketers should avoid injuries, says 'Ice baths are rubbish'
372.article_body: Ex-Australia fast bowler Brett Lee released a video on how cricketers should avoid injuries. Lee said that fast bowlers should not lift heavy weights as lean muscle mass is key. He also criticised ice baths which are used for recovery in modern-day cricket. Calling ice baths "rubbish", he stated, "There is no scientific evidence to prove that they work."

373.title: Fire breaks out at cloth market in Delhi, 35 fire tenders on spot
373.article_body: A fire broke out at a cloth market in Delhi's Gandhi Nagar on Wednesday. No casualties have been reported so far, fire department officials said. As many as 35 fire tenders reached the spot after receiving a call about the fire in the evening. As per reports, the fire tenders had to be parked far away due to narrow lanes.

374.title: IIT-Delhi's curriculum set for complete revamping: Director
374.article_body: Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi's new Director, Rangan Banerjee, said the institute's curriculum is set for a total revamping after over a decade. A panel has been formed to review the curriculum of all courses, Banerjee told PTI. "We are trying to provide in our curriculum, challenges and opportunities...hence a complete revamp was needed," he said.

375.title: India supported 85% of its rural households during the pandemic: WB
375.article_body: World Bank (WB) President David Malpass on Wednesday praised the Indian government’s support to the poor during the COVID-19 pandemic, specifically lauding India's targeted cash transfer programme. Malpass said, "Helped by digital cash transfers, India managed to provide food or cash support to a remarkable 85% of rural households." He urged other nations to adopt similar measures.

376.title: Apollo Hospitals acquires 60% stake in AyurVAID for ₹26.4 crore
376.article_body: Apollo Hospitals Enterprise Ltd has acquired a 60% stake in Ayurveda hospital chain AyurVAID for ₹26.4 crore, PTI reported. The investment will reportedly be used to upgrade existing centres and for digital health initiatives. Apollo Hospitals Enterprise Chairman Prathap C Reddy said the Apollo-AyurVAID partnership will be a beacon of hope for Indians and medical value travellers around the world.

377.title: Tamil Nadu govt invites Czech aircraft manufacturer to invest in state
377.article_body: Tamil Nadu government said that the state has invited Czech Republic-based light aircraft manufacturer Evektor Aircraft to invest in the state. Minister for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, TM Anbarasan, was explained the investment opportunities available in their country by the senior government officials during his visit to the MSV International Engineering Fair in Czech Republic.

378.title: Dhanush and Aishwaryaa decide to call off divorce after 9 months: Report
378.article_body: Dhanush and Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth, who announced their separation in January earlier this year, have decided to put their divorce on hold, as per several reports. According to reports, the families of both parties met at Rajinikanth's home and agreed that they should work on their marriage. Dhanush got married to Aishwaryaa, Rajinikanth's eldest daughter, in 2004.

379.title: Sonia Gandhi offers prayers at Karnataka temple on Dussehra
379.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi visited the Bheemanakolli temple in Begur village of Karnataka's Mysuru on Wednesday to offer prayers on the occasion of Dussehra. She was accompanied by village panchayat members and local MLA Anil Kumar C. The Congress leader is in Karnataka for the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which will commence on Thursday after a two-day break for Dussehra.

380.title: SpaceX & NASA launch crew of 4, including a Russian cosmonaut, to ISS
380.article_body: SpaceX on Wednesday launched its Crew Dragon capsule from NASA's Kennedy Space Centre in US' Florida to take two American and one Japanese astronaut and one Russian cosmonaut to the International Space Station (ISS). The capsule was launched using SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket at 9:30 pm (IST). The rocket's reusable lower-stage booster landed back safely on a drone recovery vessel.

381.title: Amit Shah visits Gurudwara Chatti Patshahi in J&K's Srinagar
381.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah visited Gurudwara Chatti Patshahi in Rainawari area of Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Wednesday, officials said. He was accompanied by Jammu and Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha and some BJP leaders. Earlier on Wednesday, Shah addressed a public rally in Kashmir's Baramulla and later visited the family members of a slain policeman in Uri.

382.title: 1 worker killed, 7 injured as elevator crashes at textile factory in Surat
382.article_body: A 35-year-old worker was killed and seven others were injured after a goods elevator crashed from the third floor of a textile factory in Surat on Wednesday. According to police, the cable snapped and lift crashed down 30 feet. "Among the seven injured, condition of five is serious as they suffered multiple fractures," CMO of New Civil Hospital said.

383.title: UP CM Adityanath feeds leopard cub with milk bottle at Gorakhpur zoo
383.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday inspected Gorakhpur's Shaheed Ashfaq Ullah Khan Zoological Park, where he also fed milk to a leopard cub. A video released by the state government showed Adityanath cradling the cub and feeding it with a milk bottle while wearing rubber gloves. MP Ravi Kishan, veterinarians and zoo officials were also present at the scene.

384.title: OPEC+ panel agrees to cut oil production by 2 million barrels/day
384.article_body: The panel of OPEC+ ministers on Wednesday agreed to cut oil production in member countries by two million barrels/day. The supply-cut could cause a rise in crude oil prices that have dropped to about $90/barrel from $120/barrel three months ago on fears of a global recession. United States of America had suggested OPEC to not proceed with the cuts.

385.title: WHO warns against taking 4 Indian cough, cold syrups after 66 kids die in Gambia
385.article_body: The WHO on Wednesday warned using four cough and cold syrups that are potentially linked to acute kidney injuries and 66 deaths among children in Gambia. The four contaminated syrups are produced by Maiden Pharmaceuticals Limited, in India, the WHO said. "WHO recommends all countries detect and remove these products from circulation," the organization added.

386.title: Elon Musk, Twitter yet to reach deal to end lawsuit: Report
386.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk and Twitter have not yet reached an agreement to end the lawsuit and execute the latter's $44-billion takeover by Musk, Reuters reported. This comes after Musk proposed to go ahead with the deal he proposed in April if Twitter dropped its lawsuit against him. Twitter and Musk's lawyers said they're attempting to try to overcome mutual distrust.

387.title: Anubhav Sinha was supposed to launch me in B'wood: Sidharth Malhotra
387.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, who made his debut in Karan Johar's 'Student Of The Year', revealed that he was to be launched in Bollywood by filmmaker Anubhav Sinha. "The film wasn't 'Fashion', but he (Anubhav) was the director who was supposed to launch me and two other actors," he stated. Sidharth added that the film didn't take off for various reasons.

388.title: You're a bully & a joke: Gigi on Kanye West insulting Vogue editor
388.article_body: Model Gigi Hadid has reacted after Kanye West insulted Vogue editor Gabriella Karefa-Johnson after she criticised Kanye's 'White Lives Matter' t-shirts. In a now-deleted Instagram post, Kanye had posted Gabriella's picture and wrote, "This is not a fashion person." Reacting to Kanye's post, Gigi commented, "You wish you had a percentage of her intellect...You're a bully and a joke."

389.title: 3 persons of a family electrocuted to death in Odisha's Boudh
389.article_body: Three persons of a family died of electrocution at their residence in Odisha's Boudh, police said. The incident took place on Wednesday when one of the deceased, Sukanti Behera, was hanging a wet cloth on a wire which accidentally came in contact with another live wire. Her son and brother-in-law were also electrocuted while trying to save her, police said.

390.title: DMK not against spiritualism, but against mixing religion with politics: TN CM
390.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Wednesday said the DMK is not against spiritualism but is against using religion for political and selfish gains. "Those using religion for their political survival allege that...Dravidian model of governance is against religion and beliefs," he said. He also accused his detractors of launching a disinformation campaign against him and his party.

391.title: 5 people drown during Durga idol immersion in Rajasthan's Ajmer
391.article_body: Five people drowned in a ditch filled with rainwater during the immersion of Goddess Durga idol in Rajasthan's Ajmer on Wednesday, police said. "They thought it was a shallow ditch and went down," SHO Hemraj said. The deceased were identified as 35-year-old Pawan Raigar, 28-year-old Gajendra Raigar, 24-year-old Rahul Meghwal, 21-year-old Lucky Bairwa and 20-year-old Rahul Raigar.

392.title: IAF deploys 2 helicopters to save mountaineers trapped in Uttarakhand
392.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) has deployed two helicopters to save mountaineers trapped in snow after an avalanche hit Draupadi ka Danda-2 mountain peak in Uttarakhand. The helicopters were deployed from Uttar Pradesh. A video shared by the IAF showed a helicopter hovering over the avalanche-hit peak. As per reports, 14 people from the mountaineering team were rescued on Wednesday.

393.title: Asteroid hit by NASA leaves 10,000 km trail of debris; pic surfaces
393.article_body: An asteroid that was deliberately hit by NASA on September 26 has left an expanding, comet-like trail of debris stretching 10,000 kilometres, a picture showed. The picture was taken two days after the impact by astronomers in Chile. On September 26, NASA's Double Asteroid Redirection Test aircraft hit the asteroid in NASA's first attempt to move an asteroid in space.

394.title: India Inc's foreign commercial borrowings increase by 4.6% in August
394.article_body: According to data from the RBI, India Inc's foreign commercial borrowings in August this year increased by nearly 4.6% to $2.98 billion. Over $2.47 billion of the total borrowings was through the automatic route of raising funds from foreign sources. While over $502.79 million was raised by way of issuing rupee denominated bonds (RDBs) or masala bonds.

395.title: Shah gets his bulletproof shield removed at Baramulla rally, video surfaces
395.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah had his bullet-proof glass shield removed from the podium before addressing a public rally in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla on Wednesday. He stated that he wanted to directly connect with the people and didn't want any sort of interruption. Shah embarked on a three-day visit to the union territory on October 3.

396.title: India will overtake US as Unilever's 'largest business': HUL CEO
396.article_body: During an interview, Hindustan Unilever's (HUL) CEO and MD Sanjiv Mehta said that India will overtake the US as Unilever's 'largest business'. "I clearly see a day when HUL will become the largest Unilever business," he said, adding that he could not give a timeframe. According to company data, HUL currently accounts for about 10.7% of Unilever group sales.

397.title: Gazprom resumes gas exports to Italy via Austria
397.article_body: Russian energy giant Gazprom said it has resumed gas exports to Italy via Austria on Wednesday after resolving an issue over guarantees. Gazprom said regulatory changes in Austria had made it possible to resume the exports. Italian energy group Eni confirmed that supplies had resumed, adding that it expected only part of the gas requested to arrive on Wednesday.

398.title: WTO forecasts further trade growth slowdown in 2023
398.article_body: The World Trade Organisation (WTO) has predicted a sharp slowdown of global goods trade growth next year as increasing energy prices, interest rates and food and fertiliser bills have curbed import demand. It said that 2023 could see a trade growth of just 1%. WTO provided a band of growth expansion of 2.0%-4.9% for 2022 and -2.8%-4.6% for 2023.

399.title: Man gets new look after robbing ₹12 crore from bank, caught in Pune 2 months later
399.article_body: Police have arrested the main accused involved in the ₹12 crore cash theft from ICICI Bank in Thane's Manpada area from Pune after more than two-and-a-half months, an official said. The accused, Altaf Shaikh, had been working with ICICI Bank as a custodian. After the incident, he escaped and would change his looks and use burqa to hide his identity.

400.title: SWIFT lays out blueprint for global central bank digital currency network
400.article_body: Financial messaging system SWIFT has laid out its blueprint for a global central bank digital currency network following an eight-month-long experiment on different technologies and currencies. The experiment included 14 central and commercial banks, connected to SWIFT's main hub, said SWIFT's head of innovation Nick Kerigan. The experiment will be followed by more advanced testing over next year.
